text: Great food!!! Our bartender Erik took care of my fiance and I very well.  Great atmosphere and prices!!!  We highly recommend this restaurant!!!

Greatest sushi find in Scottsdale. Pricing is unbelievable not even taking into account the great location. Nigiri orders $3 for two pieces?  Where do you see that?  Quality is awesome and the staff is great. Atmosphere is...well let's just say retro and if you see it with those eyes your gonna walk out with a five star experience. 

I'm so sick of walking out of sushi places feeling like I've just been taken advantage of. You will never walk out of Kyota with that in mind. And the have teppen yaki tables too!  Maybe next time, but as for now I just keep going in for the sushi.

I eat lunch here 3-4 times a month. The prices for their lunch specials are fantastic. I usually get a chicken teriyaki bowl, along with a sushi roll, and the total is about $7. I've had a variety of their sushi, and it's all been great.

This is one of my favorite local sushi joints! For a fresh and inexpensive sushi meal they can't be beat. Great service, great sushi, always fresh and really great prices. A wonderful neighborhood sushi joint.

Me, wife and daughter came here for my daughters birthday. We called in advance to see if we needed reservations. In which we did so I made a reservation for three letting them now that it was for a birthday. They asked for the birthday girls name and age. 
When we arrived we were pleasantly meet by a host and the general manager, I believe his name was Daniel an older gentleman with a cane. He explained to us the parking situation since they had no valet driver but had signs stating only valet parking.
After being sat at the end of the table not the middle since there was no one else joining our teppanyaki  table (keep in mine there were only two other tables in the restaurant a three top and a five top both being birth days. The host started off with our drinks and said our server would be with us shortly. After about 15 min. Our server came by to take our order which we ordered the tuna ta taki,edimami and the crazy roll. Once the edimami hit the table we place our order for the teppenaki order for the filet, my strip and scallops and the chicken. Half way through our main meal my wife's sushi roll arrives and I ask to see how long on my tuna tataki was going to be, but she said she forgot to put it in and if I would like her to. I told her that it would be fine since my steak was just about done. The teppanyaki chef was definitely green and still learning which was fine he was still very entertaining and even acknowledged my daughters birth day and was the best part of the meal. The food was ok very very very over priced for what you get compared to other teppanyaki After he was done and we were eating our meals our server was no ware to be found along with the rest of the servers. I ended up walking to the host stand to see if we could get some refills on our drinks and the host was very friendly and proceeded to get our drink order and refills. Our server finely came out from the back 45 min. Later to just drop off the check. The other two tables they came out and sang to the birthday people but did not for my daughter even though they were aware of her birthday.

I found this place serendipitously when I was strolling around, looking for a place to eat dinner with mom after ArtBridge Thursday. We sat at a bar where a chef made food right in front of us quietly. We chose more authentic style dishes like simple sushi and rolls without "fried and smothered in mayo crap." They were not shy with ingredients, and I thought their food was delicious.

Came in for dinner with a party of 10. Booked a reservation last minute and unfortunately did not read the reviews fully. Not impressed. The first problem was when we asked for the sushi to come out as appetizers and our server condescending told us that they can try but it "depends on how backed up the sushi guys are". That's an actual direct quote. This server was not attentive, constantly darting away from the table before we could ask for drinks, silverware, etc. The beef bullion soup that comes at the beginning of the meal tasted like they put sliced mushrooms in a bowl of ramen broth. No complaints about teppanyaki chef, but one of the tricks resulted in an actual ball of fire igniting startlingly close to the head of the four year old at the table (this is no exaggeration as we have it recorded on video). Other off putting things about this restaurant include a $7.00 up charge for fried rice and miso soup instead of the ramen broth and steamed rice it came with, crazy loud customers at other tables, bussers and food runners who literally put down plates of food hanging off of the table, and the large screen TVs in the background playing a true crime cold case file complete with closed captioning. The icing on the cake was when we waited almost 10 minutes for the server to pick up the cash payment portion of our bill (large party and some paid in cash some with cards) and she never came. We finally just got up and left- leaving the money on the table- and the hostess stopped my mother at the door and said "excuse me miss, did you pay the rest of your bill?". Not a nice way to treat your customers- especially when they have a check close to 400 dollars. I'd like to reiterate that the food wasn't bad but won't be coming back. It was an awkward and unwelcoming experience.
The volcano salmon roll and dynamite roll are great. Everything else is amazing too. Always a favorite place at downtown Scottsdale.

The food was great and the beer was cold BUT the main reason I'm coming back is because of Bailey, she was OUTSTANDING!!!

James
Best sashimi in the valley hands down! The yellow tail, tuna, salmon, rainbow rolls are all amazing!

Best sushi I've found in the desert. It's almost a shame to give it 5 stars because it's already too busy.  The sashimi pieces are huge, service has always been great and the saki-bomb setup for $4 is a steal.  I've always sat at the bar so I can't speak about the tapanyaki tables.  Then again, who would want to sit at one of those anyway?  I'll take mine raw.

I have been to Kyoto several times and food is good for the PRICE especially lunches. Phoenix has surprisingly good sushi restaurants and Kyoto is one of them. It's not NY nor LA but...

My biggest beef(or tuna) with Kyoto is their lack of sympathy for people with service animal. They DO NOT allow service animals in their restaurant.  We have two Yorkies and they are our service  dogs.  We have never been denied access to a restaurant before. This is not very AMERICAN. Maybe it's a Japanese thing:(

Anyway NO GO for animal lovers!

Overpriced for the quality of food. Rice was hard imagine buying pre made rolls at your local grocery store all day.  Uhhh no thanks.  So I took my talents down to Farm & Craft where the drinks and food were far superior.

Can't beat this place for the price and atmosphere.  Saki Bombs for $6 and sushi and tepanyaki prices way cheaper than anyplace around.  Why go to Ra or Benihana when this place is in the heart of old town and way cheaper.  Highly recommend hitting up Kyoto for dinner before going out in Old Town.

You won't find sushi anywhere in Arizona like Koyoto.  I've been eating sushi for 10+ years and have tried pretty much every where in Az and this place is very affordable,  large portions and incredibly delicious, you won't find any place like it.

Lunch for under $4.00?  You bet you.  Super cheap lunch from 11-2pm tues-sunday.  I usually get out of there with a Bento box with Chicken, rice, salad, and slices of oranges for $3.75 and a Tuna Roll for $3.50,  Super cheap!!  I heard dinner is exquisite.

We had such a bad experience after eating here. I'll start by saying the Teppanyaki was fine. Same ole, same ole on the tricks and overly salted food. When we left and went to pick up our car at the 'complimentary' valet however, they were already gone. We went back into the restaurant hoping the keys were with them. They weren't, and the Kyoto was useless. They basically told us we were on our own and didn't even bother to wish us good luck. They were so rude. I'll never go back

Really cheap and fresh sashimi that is served in a space that resembles the trailer that Budd lived in from the Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill Vol.2". Good selection of fresh fish coupled with the typical variety of sushi rolls that most people a accustomed to. Nothing too special about Kyoto but it's a great place to pop into and get your sushi fix for a low price.

Absolutely love this place. Can't get enough of it. I can't go too long without having some squid salad. I dream about it if it's been too long. The sushi and Teppan-Yaki are great. Can't wait to go again.

When we were getting ready for our trip to Arizona I got on Yelp to stake out the best Sushi places in the area. Kyoto seemed to have some of the best reviews, so we decided to check it out. We got there just in time, they close at 2pm for lunch and open back up for dinner later in the day. 
The salmon was fantastic. The unagi was fantastic. the rolls were nothing spectacular, in fact, a little dry. But, all in all, a quality sushi place. The prices were reasonable, about what you'd expect to pay for decent sushi.
What I want to know is this: Is there a good "all-you-can-eat" sushi place anywhere in Phoenix or the surrounding burbs?
Best teppanyaki place. All the food is deli and the cooks are always friendly. Filet mognon and shrimp are in my opinion the best.

The sushi is just barely above average.  The service from the wait staff is good, but the sushi chefs themselves border on rude.  Super inexpensive.  If you need a sushi fix, don't care about the service, and are poor, then this is for you.
Just like the old days. It can never reclaim those days but memory lane was fun.
I like this place. It's a fun atmosphere, the bartender is really friendly and fun. The shots 'banana cum suckers' are soooo good.

Sashimis were not fresh and warm, yes, WARM! $14 tuna toro lacked any flavors. Sea urchins taste like chemicals, and not fresh either. Nigiri rice were warm and hard so it's probably from the day before. Steak tataki were overcooked. A good place to get cheap lunch but not for good sashimi. Service was sub par. Will never come back.

Best sushi in town!  It is my favorite lunch spot because their lunch specials are incredibly cheap and their sushi is always so fresh.  I've been coming here over 10 years and the atmosphere is the same.  We take friends that are from out of town here for sushi and teppanyaki (in the evenings).  Best place ever!

Teppanyaki, Sushi, Bar & Mussels OUT OF THIS WORLD!

Whether I go to Kyoto for a special occasion and reserve a teppanyaki table, which is always a filling and fun, interactive experience, or grab a saki bomber and some sushi, I always say it's the best restaurant out there. They have a versatile menu, chefs that are approachable - both sushi and teppan have a great attitude and are super fun. Their bar has the BEST prices! One bartender told me that they have not changed their prices since they opened; something like 50 years ago!!! My only complaint is that they aren't open very often - I think their doors normally open around 6pm, and I'm not a senior citizen, but sometimes like to dine earlier :). Parking can be somewhat of a challenge, but it's to be expected in Scottsdale. I LOVE this place!!! Always have and always will!

Well, maybe my husband and I have been spoiled by all the great Japanese food available in Los Angeles. This place just does not have good Japanese food. Even something simple like chicken teriyaki and miso soup were not great. Chunky teriyaki chicken, plus big pieces of mushroom in chicken teriyaki and miso soup?! And the sushi and the sashimi were just not that great. What's up with big pieces of sea scallops for baked dynamite scallops?  So glad to be back in LA for yummy Japanese food again!

One of the first sushi spots in that area and it should be the first on your list when you're craving some Japaness goodness.

We had the soft crab roll, volcano, icsh roll, and some white tail and octopus sashimi... BUT...WE WANTED MORE! Ugh unfortunately, my stupid tummy didn't have room for more, but there's always next time!
Was having a great experience until my girlfriend pointed out a roach on the sushi bar! I understand it can happen, but it really did ruin my appetite. :(

One of my favorite spots to go to for good, cheap, and (usually) fast sushi. I usually always sit at the sushi bar, because this place can get busy at there regular tables. Usually when I'm in the mood for sushi, I go to this place. I love everything about it, the only couple times I havent enjoyed my sushi were when we had gotten a couple special rolls, which I can't even remember the name of those since they were so forgettable. Service is great, and our drinks are replenished rather quickly. My fiance and I can become stuffed with sushi for about $20 for the both of us.

I've been going to Kyoto for nearly 10 years now, by far has always been my favorite Scottsdale sushi place. The bento box lunch specials are incredible. Regretably, I have to change my opinion. 

The service has gone downhill drastically. My BF and I loved to go for the #8 sashimi box, I don't like salmon so I always sub more tuna. 9x out of 10, order comes out wrong. Haven't been there 1 time when we didn't have to sit with empty water glasses for 15 min. So we stopped going for a while. 

Yesterday, we decided to give Kyoto a 2nd chance. Service was perfectly fine this time (noticed a few new faces) but to my lament... Our sashimi was warm and mushy. NOT what you want to see! I couldn't even eat it, so gave to my BF. Well, guess who spent the next 24 hrs sitting on the porcelain throne. 

Yes, it's AZ and it's hot. But if it's not fit to eat... DON'T SERVE IT! 

I'm truly sad, but I don't think I'll be going back unless I'm in the mood for something cooked.

Went here for my bday last night and the food was just as good as it was before they closed for a while. The updates look nice and clean. Everyone from the hostess to the chef was super friendly. Sad to see the lunch prices went up but I doubt that'll stop me from going.

My wife and I love this place.  It's our favorite sushi.  Yes, it is always packed (you are a tool if you haven't figured out to get there before 7:30p for dinner), and most of it is typical N. Scottsdale kids who are at the bar and acting like idiots.  The sushi is priced cheap for Scottsdale and always tastes great, never a problem with "catching" anything, like another reviewer said, and we've been here 6 - 7 times at least.  Lunch is a really good deal too.  Never tried the grill but always looks great.
This is the best kept lunch secret in town!!! meets all my criteria.  good food, big portions and cheap.  Had California rolls, Teriyaki chicken with a salad.  It was all great!

Been going here for over 20 years.  Sushi is world class.  Not a glam sushi bar with ok overpriced sushi.  Saki bombers $6.00, was $5 20 years ago.  They don't raise their prices very often.  Lunches are a great deal too.  Teppan tables are fun for special occasions.  Great old school sushi bar!!!

Best table prep I have seen since that place in the Biltmore....love their sushi as well.  This is a downtown Scottsdale attraction and rightly so!  A must see and eat place.

We have gone there every year for my wife's birthday since we have been married, and that's now 9 years.  Always great service, and good food.

I have been a satisfied customer of Kyoto for over 15 years.  It is the first place I have tried sushi & I have taken many sushi virgins there to pop their cherry.  Sushi is fabulous & a great price.  The Dynamite is absolutely to die for.  

This is a place I've celebrated milestone bithdays, dates, many a great Saturday night.  It is a place I always want to come back to.

Came here for lunch since we work close with a group of four. Took 20 minutes for our waters to arrive then 30 minutes for the food. The only good thing about this place is at least they brought the check out quickly. No complaints on food but with as much competition as there is in the area I hope this place figures it out before their employees are out of work.

If you're looking for the best sushi and teppanyaki in Scottsdale look no further! Quick service, delicious food, and just all around good experience. I've hit up all the sushi places in Scottsdale and Kyoto has the most authentic and creative sushi. Even my friend that frequents Japan is greatly impressed with everything this place has to offer.

Don't expect perfection or anything too fancy at Kyoto. It's a hidden right in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale. Their sushi is decent and well priced for what you get. This is our very casual go to with friends when we don't want to drive up to Sakana. Hot saki (bombers) come free with beer - potentially a great spot to get a nice buzz before a night out in Old Town.

The best sushi restaurant in Arizona! I have been going many Japanese restaurant. This is the one of selling fresh food with good price!!! I'm so so so happy this place came back to business after closed down for over 1 year.

I stopped in with a friend on a Saturday night after a friend had recommended it to me and was totally thrilled we did. We sat at a table for sushi and waited no longer than 10 minutes for a table - amazing for 8 pm on a Saturday in old towne.

Unfortunately, they had sold out of the oysters, but the other dishes we'd ordered were fabulous - starting with a seared tuna dish, then softshell crab roll, rainbow roll, and the green mussels. The seared tuna was cooked and cut perfectly - just the right temperature with a peppery "rub," the rolls were a decent size with thick cuts of fish and plenty of flavorful crab, and the mussels were a tad overcooked for my preference but the creamy texture and buttery flavor still made it a winner. 

The thing I appreciated most was actually the service - we weren't rushed or hassled, and the food came out a dish at a time, giving us a chance to eat and enjoy before getting our next dish. At other sushi joints, I am constantly feeling rushed while trying to fit all of the dishes on the table (and I'm not what you'd call a slow eater!). This was a happy medium for me. The server confirmed that we were ready for the bill instead of just dropping it off without asking - it's the little details that make a big difference to me.

My only other con was creepy old men leering at us from the bar...but that's what you get in Scottsdale.

Stopped here for dinner last week, when my son and I were in town to see some spring training games.  We were seated promptly and the service was really good.  The staff is friendly and helpful.

We got the Okinawan sweet potato fries free with my Yelp check-in offer.  The fries were just OK and the Miso dressing wasn't as flavorful as we would have liked.  

However, the Eel and Cucumber roll was good.  My son ordered the Beef Teriyaki and I ordered the Chicken Teriyaki dinners.  The dishes came with a large portion of steamed rice and there were a mound of mushrooms, onions, bell peppers and egg plant under the meat.  At first glance, we thought there wasn't enough food.  However, once we dug-in and finished our dinner, we left with full stomachs and were very content. 
We enjoyed the Teriyaki sauce they use, since it was a bit thicker than most places and quite tasty.
This place was sold for the 2nd time, and is much more expensive and not good. There are too many other good sushi places with far better food.
I have been going to Kyoto for more than 20 years. It's still my favorite sushi in Scottsdale.

Cons:
-Service SUCKS (for lack of a better word) so bad during lunch hours. There's a waitress who always works there during lunch hours who's so spacey that she will never see you if you need her attention. Refilling drinks is not apart of her job description either, I'm guessing. Kyoto (whether it be the servers or the people preparing the food) gets our order wrong about 80% of the time.
-Food is a hit or miss thing. Some of their stuff is heavenly good, and some of it tastes like sewage. Trying asking for a recommendation from someone.
-You need reservations if you go there on a weekend night, guaranteed.

Pros:
-Go during lunch hours! The prices are insanely great! You can get a whole bento box with sashimi for around or less then $5! Considering the usual price of sashimi combos, this is the best deal I've seen ever.
-The sashimi (which encompasses most of what I've had there anyway) is also extremely fresh and the servings are relatively generous.

Overall: Service is below average, but the sushi is high quality for a great price.

Kyoto is by far my favorite place to eat sushi in Scottsdale. The atmosphere feels authentic, the prices are great, and the staff is top notch. One of the best places to throw a birthday party, have a fun date, or just hang out with some friends. Reserve a table for some cooked Japanese food and be witness to a show then enjoy a very tasty treat. Hang out in the bar and get served by a friendly bar tender who will give you advice for the rest of your evening. Can't wait for my next time.

I was supposed to come for dinner here tonight for a friends birthday dinner. I have a gluten allergy however so I called ahead to make sure I would be able to eat. The man I spoke to on the phone was extremely rude and even acted offended that I was asking. He said they had gluten free soy sauce, but that they didn't really have any gluten free options which I found confusing. Am I supposed to have gf soy sauce on the side of nothing for dinner? He then said that they aren't an American restaurant so they don't have "the kind of stuff" to make things gluten free. I understand that not all restaurants are able to accommodate a gluten free menu or gluten free options, but his passive aggressive tone and rudeness were completely unwarranted. I simply inquired. I have also been to dozens of other Japanese restaurants that have gluten free options and much better customer service so I will be taking my business to one of those. Kyoto lost a party of 5 tonight. I hope his bad attitude was worth it to them.

Ok. Let me qualify this 4 star rating.

It's for lunch. And it's mostly for price.

It's certainly not the best Japanese restaurant I've ever been to. And the food isn't the best. But it's decent. The price is excellent (for lunch).

I used to come here often and grab the Bento box and a California Roll with my buddies for lunch and I'd the door having spent just 10 bucks including tax and tip. I'd be full, and ready to coast through the afternoon on a semi-food coma.

It's worth the visit based on the cost. 

Now you probably want to know why I don't think this is the best restaurant in the world. Well, this is an OLD place. It hasn't been updated since the NIxon administration...at least it seems that way....but what do I know? I was born during last Carter year. 

The Bento Box is $3.75 and you get Teriyaki Chicken w Mushrooms, Rice, a little salad. It's really not bad for the price.  Add a roll for another $3.75 and you got yourself a snazzy cheap little meal.

The restaurant is dark, it kind of smells, but who cares. It's cheap, you'll be in and out of there in no time.

I probably wouldn't go there for dinner. 

Peace.

Ok, it was my first time back here in 9 years. It's so much better than my previous experience. 

The service was great from the moment I got there. A friend & I sat at the sushi bar & had a fabulous cocktail named something with the word spirit in it. Who can remember these things? I've included a photo. 

We were there for a drink and a happy hour snack. We got a couple different kinds of rolls, & both were really good. I'll definitely be back again & much sooner this time.
Amazing presentation and accuracy with taste. Great sushi in Scottsdale. The Chef came out multiple times to make sure we were taken care of.

Food- The sushi is rather poorly rolled for my taste.  Many of the rolls are large in size which is normally good but in this case leads to the sushi falling apart when dipping in soy due to the poor technique in rolling them.  

Price- It is not as cheap as it should be for the quality but it isn't terrible for sushi prices generally.

The food tastes ok but I find that the poor technique is too much for me to get past when eating sushi.  Fish quality is fine but not the best I have had in Phoenix.

Service- This is by far the worst thing about this restaurant.  NEVER SIT AT THE SUSHI BAR because you will have servers constantly reaching over your shoulders all night (during dinner service at least). The servers should have a place to get food for the tables without having to reach over customers.  This is a total failure of this restaurant design.

I get so angry at the bumping and shoving by the servers at the sushi bar that I will never go back.  Each time I go to give them another shot there aren't any tables and they sit me at the bar.  

Go somewhere else to avoid the sub-par, expensive food and terrible service during busy hours.

I've been coming to this place since college, and I can tell you its definitely one of those "an oldie but a goodie".  So, its not a fancy schmancy place with hip party music playing and it doesn't serve mixed drinks with cute names like "hello kitty", but it should be a staple to anyone's lunch place repertoire.  

They serve bento boxes (basically a lunch box with rice, your choice of entree, salad and slices of oranges--a healthy dessert!) for $3.75.  If you're feeling like a high roller, you can order the sashimi bento box, and that will set you back a whopping $6.

Who says you can't eat good for cheap?

I have been going to this place for thirty plus years. It is in serious need of an update inside and out. The upside is that the food is great and the prices are even better. We had tempura, a specialty sushi roll, and a chicken bento box for $20. Seriously good deal.

Great time! Food was good, & the service was awesome. I was a bit apprehensive because if all the bad reviews but we went anyways because it's close to home & I'm glad we gave it a chance. Thanks for a wonderful evening.

I have been to Kyoto about 3-4 times in the past 7 years.  I still hasn't changed a bit since the first time I went there when I was fifteen!  I always eat at the grills.  I love places with the tepanaki (I dont know how to spell it) grills.  I have been to many many places like this and Kyoto is just ok.  This place needs some serious redecorating.  It looks like the place is stuck in the 1970's.  The food is good though.  Last time our grill cook was really bad and was droping things all over the place but hey everyone has an off day sometimes.  I may go here again just because its so close to my home but otherwise I've had better.

Food was excellent, the chef at the table was good, however the wait staff as well the bartender were extremely oblivious to their surroundings.  Not once was I offered another drink.  I constantly had to flag someone down in order to keep from being parched.

CLOSED....I just called and got the updated message that due to unforeseen problems with the renovation...they won't reopen til JANUARY possibly FEBUARY...hopefully they get it together and can reopen soon...l like Kyoto
I love this place! I been dining here for 12 years. Very low price for lunch and fish is flown fresh daily!
Overpriced and very odd atmosphere.  Its old and low ceilings.  Location was great and the food was good--just way too high for what you get.

Sushi was FANTASTIC. Our server, Hector, was an awesome guy, very helpful, very willing to accommodate. We got all sorts of rolls, and each one was better than the last. The Alaska roll came with lemon slices on it, which was my favorite touch. What a place!

When I'm cruising PHX and can't make it to Sakana then I come here.  

Friday and Saturday nite is like a frat party.  By now, any night in Scottsdale must be like a frat party.  Go midweek, sit at the bar and enjoy the quality of this place.  See you next month.

So the food was phenomenal. We started with the hot sake and moved to the Japanese whiskey old fashioned  from there we got the pork gyoza, slice of heaven roll and spicy señorita roll. Service was spot on and when it took a while to bring a drink they comped it. Since we couldn't get enough we finished with the fiery dragon roll. We're savory over sweet so no need for desert. We will definitely be back, oh and Paula was such a doll. Super professional and on top of things. Highly recommend!!!

I have been a patron of Kyoto for 15 years, in fact went on a really bad date there when I was 21.  Even though the date was painfully bad it didn't ruin my taste for Kyoto.  Now I love sushi and have been to many places in town so I have much to compare it to.  But the reason I come here more than any other place is I can enjoy a great sashimi lunch for less than $10 dollars or come have dinner plus drinks for around $25.  That makes me and my wallet very happy.  I walk to it from work and have lunch usually once a week. Have taken 3 of my stylist who have never been there before and turned them in to Kyoto fans.  The service is great, really friendly and I like that they recognize me always asking "how's business?  Good to see you again!"  It is another place here in old town that make me feel like I am not lost in the tourist shuffle.

well..... yea ...

this is scottsdale original sushi bar that has been awarded for the best sushi for more than 16 yrs? reallly? wait a second.. we ARE in arizona, so hmm, mebe the standards are quite different ... 

i, for one, was not thrilled ...  must say the sushi was quite ginormous but it sure didn't taste all that yummy and fresh... an average sushi ranged from $4 and up but honestly, if i was living in scottsdale, i would TOTALLY come for lunch... where can you find a deal for less than $5? whether you get chicken teriyaki/cutlet or whatever it was literally $3.50. YES! for lunch!!!

$3.50 for lunch! so unheard of! +1 for that

dinner?

an average dinner is $20/up... SO not worth it... 

and who puts big chunky mushrooms in miso soup and sadly, there wasn't a SINGLE TOFU! is it just me or is that simply weird?
Good quality for the price. The food tastes very well like other people reviewed. It wasn't like real Japanese style, but it is still okay to have a decent meal in the casual atmosphere.

I'm glad I can finally write a review for this place. I've been a customer since 2013 and I was so happy to hear they opened again! The lunch specials are amazing. Generous portions, great variety, tastes delicious and the prices are the best in all of old town.

If you work, live, or happen to be in the area, do yourself a favor and come here for lunch! If you're having dinner plans, they have Teppanyaki tables as well so you can enjoy the show and great food.

Sushi selection is also quite awesome and the staff is always friendly. I only have amazing things to say about this place over the years. Thanks to Kyoto for being around!

Sushi was good atmosphere was great. The service was awful. We ordered drinks from our waitress that seemed as if she was on drugs or just so ditsy because she didn't know the menu or anything about the restaurant or how to talk to customers. Anyway, we waited 15 min before finally asking why our drinks hadn't came. Our waitress was no where to be found the rest of our time at the restaurant. Also, she never brought out our meal we had to grab it ourselves from the sushi bar because nobody cared to wait on us.

Not impressed. The service was slow and they never asked for drink-refills. The waitress seemed to be MIA most of the night. 

I was excited to hear that they serve GLUTEN FREE soy sauce but you have to watch how they prepare it. They poured normal soy sauce all over my meal and I had to have them recook mine. We had a large group of ppl (15) and we agreed we won't be returning. 

On a positive note.....the sushi was awesome!

Don't expect much from this place. Place is dingy, especially for it being in Scottsdale. The service was okay, but the sushi rolls were sub par. There was even one roll, the group couldn't even finish because the fish tasted old. 

We won't be back.

Every time I've been here the food has been excellent! Whenever family comes into town and we can't think of a place to go Kyoto always comes up because it never disappoints! The entrées are a decent portion, we always split them cause unless you're starving you won't be able to finish it on your own. I do have to say though that every time we've gone we've only ever done the teppanyaki so I don't know what their bento is like but I can't imagine it being bad. Def go with a cool group and enjoy the show!

My husband and I LOVE sushi date nights because it is something that I don't make at home. That said, Kyoto is one of our go-to spots because you can sit at the sushi bar and watch their chefs work their magic + they have an INCREDIBLE happy hour! 

ALSO - check in on Yelp for a complimentary Sunomono Salad (cucumber salad). It is a big portion too! 

My absolute musts when I come are spicy edamame, miso soup, house salad (I love their ginger dressing), fried rice, and then...the SUSHI! We actually switch up the rolls every time because we like to try new things but last night, we ordered the CRAZY roll and you guys - it was a dream come true! I'm currently obsessed with shishito peppers and this roll was topped with them + they DO NOT skimp on the avocado. Yes, please! We also love the basics like spicy tuna, spicy crab, etc. Also, their fried rice is the best fried rice that i've EVER had. It is SO flavorful and you can order a small side if you don't want the big order. But the big order has chicken, steak, AND shrimp in it. Pretty hard to resist. 

Anywho, we'll definitely be back soon! Thank you for always curing our sushi cravings! :)

A true Scottsdale tradition, Kyoto offers fabulous sushi in a dive-y yet oh-so-hip atmosphere. Their Tako Salad is one of the best and the teppanyaki tables (for those who want cooked food) really are a blast.

Kyoto's hidden secret is its great lunch specials. You can get your sushi fix for under $10 and avoid the crowds that come in the evening.  Bento boxes with terriaki chicken will please your non-sushi friends. I'm so glad this place survived downtown Scottsdale's growth spurt!
Good food, highly questionable service! Without a good location, and a long history, they would struggle... Someone needs some customer service training. Like their entire staff!

I regretably went here for my birthday last night.

Ordered the Ichi roll and got a death mayo alien roll.

This was the worst thing I have ever tasted. 

1) it had at least a handful of mayo blahh

2) it had a pound of crab that looked like red/white spaghetti ( soo gross)

3) had the texture of a raw pumpkin sliced in thin strings

4) tasted like licking an old fish

We got the waitress to refund the sushi since it was un-edible. 
when she brought the bill it was not itemized and we could not figure out how it came to that much.
The entire time our waitress was never there, never refilled our drinks.
We finally flagged her down to get a break down of the bill.
she came back with the same copy!!!
We asked a different person who grabbed her to help us.
She came to the table and asked "do you have a problem with me?" WTF!!!

We told her  ignoring what she said " can you just bring us a breakdown of the bill"

She came back AGAIN, with an un itemized copy!!

I would not have tipped her but on parties of 6+ the add 17% gratuity

Which btw she added 20% without permission.

We were there for so long ad wanted to leave otherwise I would have disputed that tip charge in full.

You dont come up to customers and ask if they have a problem with you!!!

Not only was the food the grossest shit ever, the service can suck my ass!!

My husband and I visited this past weekend for the second time. The first time was about 4 years ago and the food and service was excellent. Unfortunately this time was unsatisfactory. First, I called to make a reservation and was told to come at a later time because the restaurant was busy. When we arrived 20 mins earlier, the restaurant was dead. We sat at an 8 person grill with one other couple. The chef came quickly and our food was all prepared in 15 mins. My main complaint concerns the portions of food. I ordered the shrimp dinner and was given 8 tiny shrimp. I was hungry when we left. At other teppanyaki restaurants, the portions are healthy and satisfying. My husband ordered steak and shrimp. The steak was overcooked and he also received 8 shrimp. His portions were acceptable. His meal was $5 more than mine and received twice the amount of food. Moral to this story - order a combo or you'll be hungry and I mean very hungry!!!

Sushi that won't strain your budget.  Kyoto Japanese has been my go to place for Sushi for 25+ years now.  Lunch is the best value in town.  If you are looking for a swank, place to be seen Sushi joint, then head down the street to one of the other plentiful Japanese / Sushi restaurants.  If you are looking for a place with good sushi at a reasonable price and a friendly staff to serve you, then visit Kyoto.  I did notice that they recently raised prices after 25 years but I think you can still afford it. The price for a Tuna Roll is now a whooping $4.  Come on....you can't beat that and it is always fresh.   The Teppanyaki tables are fun and entertaining.

Oh, almost forgot......A Sake Bomber / Sake with a 22oz Beer is just $6 (at least last time I checked)

 If you have not been to Kyoto, be sure to make this one of your upcoming destinations.

Love love love! This is the go-to place when my boyfriend and I want sushi. And we are sushi lovers.

The prices are ridiculously low for the quality and location. Regardless of pricing, the sushi is still the best in the Valley (in my opinion). This is also coming from a Japanese girl :)

In our most recent visit, my boyfriend and I sat at the sushi bar and asked the chef for a recommendation. We ordered the Hawaiian Ono sashimi because of it, and it was tasty! We love our standard selection, but it's nice to order new things every now and then.

When you go for lunch, the specials are even cheaper in price and just as delicious. I have no complaints about this place.

Update!

Went back last night for dinner, this place is still awesome. I had the Las Vegas Rolls, they were pure deep fried goodness.

Though I'm familiar with Scottsdale and live close to Old Town I had somehow never noticed Kyoto despite it's proximity to the Breakfast club and Bungalow.

I had gone with a friend who wanted sushi, thinking (and not really minding) that he was talking about the Kyoto Bowl on Scottsdale Rd near the Walgreens. No no no. This is a much better culinary experience by far.

Besides the surprise birthday details we were seated at one of the teppanyaki tables and this not being my first time it was a great experience. There wasn't any showboating by the cook this time but that was fine with me. Had an array of sushi that was all fresh tasting and well proportioned and some excellent sake too. 

It might be slightly priced on the high end of things (but I didn't pay for it so I can't say precisely more about it) but a great place to go eat with friends or a loved one.

As mentioned earlier, the best thing about this place is the super cheap, but super delicious lunch bentos.  You get a main dish, rice, salad, and an orange for under $4. If that's not enough, you can get double meat for a buck or two more.  I highly recommend the ginger pork or the katsu.  My friend I normally go with is a big fan of the white fish (fried or grilled).  The sushi here isn't bad.  It's nothing super special, but I don't come here for the sushi so it's not a big knock against the place.

As they would say on ebay: A+++ Great Seller! Would eat here again!!!

Alright, lets set a few things straight. My experience equates to a three, yes, however I was almost tempted to give it a 4, simply to offset some of the ridiculously unjustified one or two star reviews I've read below. 

*To complain about the tuna in a spicy tuna roll being mashed, because it ruins the texture and the flavor of the tuna? Sincerely, if its texture and integrity of tuna flavor that your looking for perhaps you shouldn't be eating a roll where traditionally, you "mash" the tuna, adding a slew of "spicy" seasonings into it? Try the sashimi perhaps? Just a thought.

*To give a restaurant a 2star rating because they didn't provide noodles like Benihana? Also might be an unfair comparison. 

*Another 2 star rating because they didnt like the hostess stand being by the door? I'm not even sure I understand this complaint.

Anyhow, here goes my own personal experience.

Promptly greeted and as the restaurant was full, even on an off night, were seated at the sushi bar, which is fine, because its where we wanted to go anyhow. Ordered a cocktail from their slightly pedestrian bar offerings. A little surprised that the edamame wasn't complimentary, but didn't mind too much since, one - i think this might be a Scottsdale thing - and two, both it and the soup, as many people have stated, were very inexpensive. Ordered sushi, and a few tidbits from the kitchen, Server was nice, friendly and as attentive as could have been expected as busy as she was. Sushi was slightly undersized in portions (and yes, even for classic Japanese standards) but when the bill came, it reflected the size fittingly, leaving no thoughts as to it being over-priced. Sushi Chef (not the owner.) was skilled but seemed either lacking in rapport with the guests, or just too busy to show some sense of personality.*shrug, but i suppose as long as he gets the job done, thats all that matters. Experience was altogether pleasing, but did seem as if there was always a ying to the yang to consistently make the 4 star experience back to a 3. 

PROS: *Pleasant server
              *Good sushi, quality fish, nice cuts.
              *Undersized portions but also very reasonable price tags

CONS:   *Fairly pedestrian bar and sake selections. 
                 Bar i can forgive, but wish the sake selection was a little
                  more interesting.
                 *No little freebies that you see in some other Japanese
                  restaurants. Edamame, Soup, even the rice, yep..paid for.
                * No desserts available whatsoever. Nada, Zip Zilch.

You know what? I AM going to give it a 4, because if the pricing, quality and service for lunch is anything like dinner, I'm still a fan and ill definitely be trying this place again. (Also, like i said to help offset some of what I think are those unfair one and two star reviews.) True, nothing blew me away about the experience...but definitely nothing so overwhelming  bad to deserve a 1 or 2 star review. Next time I'm craving sushi, Kyoto will work just fine. Hope this helps!

The staff took 10 minutes to get my friend and I menus and water. The sushi staff completely forgot about our order 30 min after getting salads and the appetizer. This place seems to be running in disarray.

I was told this place used to be the "hot spot"  back in the day.  My review is strictly based on the bar and teppan experience(I have not tried their sushi yet).  

We had 9 in our group on a Thursday night and we started off with a round of beers at the bar.  It's a nice touch that every beer we ordered came with a small bottle of sake!  The bar is small and we pretty much took up the whole area, which also happens to be right where the front door of the place is.

There are a few teppan tables in the very back of the place, and our group of 9 just barely fit comfortably.  The "show" before the cooking started was one of the better ones I've seen(it was the first time I've seen them light a trail of fire around the table and into each of our dinner plates!).  I ordered steak and lobster with fried rice, and it turned out pretty delicious.  One disappointment I had during the cooking process was that the fried rice was not prepared for us on the grill...it came out in bowls straight from the kitchen.  

The miso was ok, nothing to write home to mom about.

They do NOT have "golden shrimp"(I'm beginning to think no teppan place in Arizona has this).

Bathrooms are small and kind of grungy(1 urinal, 1 stall, 1 sink).

We went here on Valentine's Day for a friend's birthday.  I do love that it is a local version of Benihana's.  But they are lacking in their flavor.  I wish they would have made the fried rice in front of us instead of bringing it out with our food already made.  Sure, this would make it like all those other places...except this meant we only got to watch the chef make our grilled veggies and meat.  It made for a slightly less exciting experience.  We did enjoy our food though and it is worth at least one trip in, especially if you are a supporter of local restaurants.  Don't come in thinking it is like the bigger more mainstream versions though.

My family and I went there for father's day and had as great time. Food is always excellent but a bit slow due to cooked to order which I prefer. This is the few places you can get sushi fully cooked, prepared.  I love the deep fried Vegas roll. As for price, it is higher than most. You really do get higher quality meats and well worth the price differences. Our waitress was attentive and explained the menu, options well. Will definitely return soon for the happy hour specials and the secret Ramen bowl item.

Memories of a favorite restaurant are all that remains. Sashimi platter is overpriced and underwhelming. The sushi bar operating like a food prep counter at a grocery store.  Other folks are more succinct with the recent disappointment here but it's agreed: skip it.
Had a variety of rolls and saki bombs.  Everything was fresh and tasted great.  Will definitely return.

Came here for a birthday, two of us had the teppanyaki and one had sushi. We all ordered drinks, all of which were disappointing. Two of the three sushi rolls ordered came out about 20 minutes before the teppanyaki chef, so she had already finished eating both of those by the time the chef came out. The last roll came out as we were finishing eating the teppanyaki. The sushi rolls were all good and the only reason for two stars instead of one. The two of us who ordered teppanyaki both got the filet mignon, both of which were the worst filets we've ever had. The meat was very sour and unpleasant. As others have mentioned, the veggies in the fried rice are frozen and the rice is bland. While the sushi was good, we won't be returning. There are other sushi restaurants in Phoenix and Scottsdale that are more affordable and far better.

My mom and I were drawn in by the reasonably priced lunch menu and convenient location- but we quickly discovered that the reasonable menu equated terrible food.  The lunch menu is priced so reasonably ($5-$8 for a complete bento box) that I worried about the quality of the food as we placed our order.  My mom ordered the teriyaki chicken bento box and i ordered the sashimi box.  Neither of us liked the salad dressing (too much ginger), although people who like ginger will probably enjoy it.  I literally had to spit out my first bite of sashimi (tuna).  It was the most fishy and rough piece of fish I've ever tasted.  It was absolutely atrocious and the flavor remained in my mouth long after i spit it out.  After that first bite, I decided against trying the other sashimi out of concern that I would get sick.  My mom's chicken was also terrible- she described it as tough and over cooked.  We politely told the waitress (an older lady, possibly the owner) that we were both unable to eat our meals.  She rudely informed me that the fish was fresh and there was nothing wrong with it.  (note: if that is what they consider fresh fish, then their standards are VERY low).  I apologized and told her that I was unable to eat it.  She grabbed the plate away, but refused to take my mother's food (stating that there was nothing wrong with the chicken).  Another waitress came by and we explained the situation to her.  She was very nice and apologized, and my mom and I left the restaurant.  The food was so atrocious that we literally left without eating!

This hidden gem in the heart of old town Scottsdale is a must. Great sushi, cheap prices and casual environment. Service can be a hit or miss. The sushi bar is great as they are engaging and you learn about all different kinds of sushi! Stop in...you won't be disappointed.

"A-OK". That describes fairly accurately my experience here. I imagine if I had gone for the teppanyaki I would have a higher rating, but I was in the mood for sushi.

Unfortunately, the sushi selection here is extremely limited. The fish was nice and fresh, although not the best I've had. And there was a strange spice on the white fish that I found quite surprising. Not necessarily bad, but it seemed out of place. The tako salad was quite tasty, although it was absolutely drowned in ponzu sauce, so beware!

Overall, I wouldn't consider this as a "destination" to go back to; however, I wouldn't say no if I were invited to go eat here again.

The flavor of the food was alright but somewhat bland. The guy who made our food at the table was very nice but there was some miscommunication with our order.  We thought they would cook the fried rice in front of us so we paid extra, and then they just brought it to us in a bowl. So nobody ate the rice we paid extra for because it wasn't special...or what we expected. 

Overall, probably would not return with my family.

I was tempted to give this place only 3 stars, but since the food is good and the prices are great I gave it 4. The service is pretty bad though. They either rush you or leave you for a long time. I have to be careful if its on my lunch break. You seriously cant find anything cheaper in Old Town. Its hidden and the parking can be awful, but its worth it. The bento boxes are perfect for lunch and cheap. I wish that they would come with a cali roll like most. If your looking for a very casual place for sushi this is a great spot. Not a date night place or anything. Pretty run down. I guess its been around for a long time so I'm thinking they should do some maintenance.

Our family went to Kyoto to celebrate my brother's birthday and it was so much fun! The servers sang Happy Birthday with special Japanese lyrics and everyone in the restaurant clapped along. We sat at one of their teppanyaki grill tables so we really got a great show with the onion volcano and flaming plates and everything.  The filet mignon, lobster, scallops, shrimp & fried rice were all delicious.  Definitely going back for my birthday this year!!

Service awesome. Very friendly and social. Sashimi very good.  $ for product over rated.  Lady got veggie roll $8.. nothing special. Happy hour sake bomb.. best deal there, $4.. haven't been able to find better. Roll average.  Haven't tried teppan yet, will go back for 2nd run at it.. the staff is the main reason we will return.

go for the screamin lunch menu!  all the usual fare for $3.50 and up.  plus it's in a nice area and the decor is pleasant.

you can get the same stuff in a styrofoam bowl at those other places but why not eat it out of a bento box and look stylish at the same time?

not earth shattering but then again, it won't cost you and arm and a leg...
I love this place and I love the manager Dwayne he's so friendly, the staff is always nice, atmosphere's amazing, food is fabulous.. I totally recommend it and there teppanyaki bar's great too.
Awesome spot. Food was excellent and prices were very reasonable. The service was stellar and the vibe was welcoming. Highly recommend.

I used to go here before they remodeled/closed for a few years. I wanted to love it, but most things have changed from before. Besides the price increasing which is understandable for Scottsdale, their chicken terriyaki entree is completely different. Before it was covered with thick delicious sauce with yummy chunks of mushroom; now it is an almost flavorless watery sauce with a few tiny mushrooms. Their salad was also my favorite, which now tastes different and is served with bitter spring mix instead of the ice berg, that I think goes better with it... I am hoping for other guests they turn up the flavors a little. At $10 I can get a better tasting chicken from RA or Kabuki.

This place used to be my favorite sushi place when I first started going about 9 years ago. As the years go by, the quality, freshness, and taste of the food has failed to please. I used to recommend this place to friends and visitors, but now I can't even get myself to go in there for a meal.

???????????????Translation: "Oh, how the mighty have fallen!"

Many years ago this was a very lovely restaurant, delicately balancing good service, a casual atmosphere, quality food, and good prices, to deliver a delightful dining experience at a good value.

Not so, anymore! The prices have gone up significantly, to the point where this restaurant is priced higher than the finest sushi restaurants in metro Phoenix.  The service had gone down... Lots of loud confusion from the staff, which interrupts the dining experience. 

I ordered salmon sashimi, a seaweed salad, and a side of rice.  The sashimi was delivered first, out of order... Why, I wondered? I'll get to that later. Then came the salad, which was small, but decent. I had to ask my server for the side of rice, which of course, should have been delivered with the sashimi.

Most condemning is the quality of the food. At the tail end of my meal, something on the wall caught my attention... Several chef's knives were magnetically affixed to the walk, which isn't unusual per se.  What was unusual, however, was that none of the sushi chefs (I use the term chef generously) were using knives, and the knives on the wall were extremely dull, so much so that their lack of use and maintenance (sharpening) was visually apparent from several feet away, across the bar.  I wondered... If nobody is using knives, how do they cut the fish? Not to worry, Kyoto patrons!  The sashimi and nigiri is pre-cut!  That way... You can be sure to get your fish as quickly as possible, even before the appetizer salad that you order with your meal!

The fish itself was bland, low quality, poorly cut, and selfishly portioned.

Shame on you, Kyoto, for allowing something good and honest turn into a chaotic mess masquerading as a Japanese restaurant.  I would probably forgive the founders / original owners, because no doubt they cashed out a few years ago, selling to owners who left patrons with this ersatz sushi. 

Full disclosure: the advertised happy hour drink prices appeared to be worthwhile enough to stop in here for a drink.  Just do yourself a favor and skip everything else.

Walking by this place, I always thought it was closed, but apparently its not!
I had a craving sushi so my date took me here. What a shocker! The sushi was really yummy and the service was pretty good. This restaurant has a sushi bar, tables, teppanyaki tables, and a bar. I enjoyed the atmosphere, it was pretty low key compared to other sushi joints in Old Town, which is nice change. I will be coming back!

The service was terrible, the bartender was working alone and took 30 minutes to get a drink. Also one of the staff had drank all of the Tito's tequila and replaced it with water. Our reservations as for 7:30pm and did not get seated till 9pm. In addition two people from our part got sick from the food. The previous owner from a year ago did a much better job at running the place. I will never come back.

I am so impressed with this place! Came to old town for breakfast but every place had a ridiculous wait. We noticed that Kyoto was open and they had a sign that said they served breakfast. We decided to give it a shot and we are so glad we did. So good and great prices!

Kyoto does a good job of doing what it does.  That being said, if you've been to one Kyoto, you've been to them all.  

Tepanaki (you know what I'm trying to spell here dont you?) tables, the Japanese dude lighting onion towers on fire on the table in front of you...taking pictures to put on your birthday mug...yes, its all the same.  But its all good.  Delicious actually.  Never a bad meal have I eaten at Kyoto.  

Never have I not waited in a line as long as the nile either.  "But I have reservations!"  They dont care.  Tell Lisa-Lipgloss to hurry her sweet cheeks up because they wont seat any of you until shes there.  Pony up to the bar for some savory (and surprisingly super cheap) saki bombs while you wait, and you'll forget you actually came to eat.  If you still have an urge to eat, do it right and get both sushi and a tepan-cooked meal...you'll be impressed and its not overpriced, you get a ton of food.

Bring your appetite, patience and your valet money and roll through Kyoto...the annoyances are worth your weight in sushi.

Thank God Kyoto is back.   Been coming here for thirty years.   This is as authentic as it gets.   Had the Masago Nigiri with eggs -- one word exquisite.  Had the Beef Sashimi extra spicy -- so awesome.   The fried rice is the best.  Just the best most authentic Sushi in Az.  Masa started this place long ago, he would be proud that the food is still the best sushi in Az     Try the Saki bombers, they have 12 flavors.  Perfect local joint*****

I have been here twice and both times I ordered a rare steak and both times I received a medium steak. The rest of the food is delicious though. The atmosphere and service is good. It's expensive though and I feel like there are better restraurants to drop 100 dollars at for two.

I have been a patron for YEARS!  There is no better sushi in Scottsdale. Their fish is as fresh as it gets, they are wonderful people and when we walk in the door, they know where to look at the sushi bar to see if our spots are available...unless Lisa is working at the bar, then we eat there!

Stumbled upon this place around dinner time and decided to give it a try. Bad decision.

I will first give you the worst. My fiance had explosive diarrhea all night after eating here. He ordered Ichi Roll.

I wish I had read the review on this restaurant then I would have avoided this place. The other reviewer has described this Ichi Roll. I completely agree. Gross. In addition to what he described, this roll is huge, the size of a burger patti! No roll should be so big that you can't fit in your mouth. That just goes to show the chef does not know Japanese cuisine.

I ordered dragon roll, which is eel and avocado. Overall flavor is okay but the texture of the fish is mushier than usual that it makes me think perhaps it's not fresh.

The green tea. Watered down. Not much flavor.

Edamame. Tasted like store bought Edamame, but it's the kind that's overstocked and about to expire. You get the Idea.

So, will I come back to this restaurant? You tell me.

Best sushi in old town Scottsdale. Great food and prices are reasonable. Service is super friendly. Atmosphere is great and they have two different bars. Went in for dinner and we had six rolls between two people which was plenty of food. Fish is fresh and delicious. Great for families or a meal with a group.

Dude this place totally sucks a bums nacho cheese nut sack!!! i went there one time Cause everyone was like this place is sooo good, they jack off on your food its great. that sounded good, but when i went there no jacking off on the food, wtf!! but seriously the sushi roll we ordered was the size of a chipotle burrito and tasted like an old obese man farted threw an onion in to a tuna fish can!! not only did the food have quality that only McDonald's can do but the service was terrible. our waitress pulled out a shotgun and stuck it in my mouth and told me to say hello to the devil for her! i couldn't believe it considering we were eye fucking each other across the room to the ghost theme song. she made me tip her, and not the tip i wanted to give her.... mm mm. oh sorry anyway, if u want white trash gas station quality sushi and service that would make you feel like your in the movie Saw than eat at Kyoto " Home of the Garbage Roll".... one other thing they serve there food on a garbage lid

First of all let me start by saying this was one of the best experiences I've had in old town Scottsdale. Our server Bailey did an outstanding job describing each sashimi to our table. 

I ordered the ponyo refresher and I gotta say it was one of the better cocktails Scottsdale has to offer!  Service was amazing bussers came by assuring we had drinks filled and tables clean and our server was very attentive of our needs. Definitely 5 out of 5!!!!

If you come in ask for BAILEY

Thank you Bailey and the Kyoto family for the hospitality we received today !

The chef was great; very entertaining! The creepy manager looming around the hibachi tables was weird, to say the least. When I saw frozen  veggies on the grill as an ingredient for fried rice I was done. Even Panda Express uses fresh veggies! I've heard this is a great place for drinks, not food. Unfortunately, that was after we ate here.

Kyoto continues to be a rockin' good time! Every time I visit, Kyoto provides an activity dinner experience! Between the saki bombs, the entertaining chef and the good food, Kyoto has the tri-fecta. Be warned that on the weekends, you will experience a wait, so it's best to call ahead and make a reservation.

Food was very good. Hibachi chef wasn't as enthusiastic as I'm used to and wasn't considerate of my parties years, but the food was good. Sushi wasn't the bad, but what can you expect from a restaurant in the middle of the desert? Sushi chef's play loud pip music, which I didn't mind but if you're not a fan, you won't like it. I usually like more of a Japanese type feel. Not sure if I'd go again

I went to Kyoto with some girlfriends from work and we had a blast. Let me just say their bento lunch specials cannot be beat. 

To start, we all ordered the miso soup- IT WAS EXTRAODINARY! I would live off that soup if I could. It had so many mushrooms in it which I love. For my meal,  I got the chicken in teriyaki sauce- which came with salad, rice, and orange slices. I ate it all. The best part all of my meal was only $6. 

I had friends get the sashimi and the tempura bento boxes. I think I might try the tempura box the next time we go. The server and host were very nice.

There is a reason why when I lived in Scottsdale for 3 1/2 years I never ate at Kyoto. But upon my last visit I decided I should try a new place.
Hmmmm.... I now have also learned to ALWAYS trust my trusty yelper's reviews. 
This was a bad choice on my part. Bad, slow service. Poor sushi selection. No wine menu. 
The sushi came out cut as thick as a piece of steak. I hate thickly cut sushi. Rolls.....bland. Ambiance was that of a cheap, generic restaurant. 
The good.....cheap, sushi was fresh and didn't taste bad.
But with all that being said I'll pass on a next time here.

Great find! The boyfriend and I were aiming to check out Geisha A Go Go's happy hour but no seats and loud music drew us to find a more intimate spot. Kyoto hit the spot! The sushi was great at a reasonable price off the regular menu. The staff was friendly and laid back yet still attentive which was refreshing.  I loved all the rolls we tried: (in order of favorites) caterpillar, Philadelphia, Salmon volcano (warning it is salt that they light on fire), tuna maki, and another I can't remember. Although the boyfriend is still partial to Roka Akor, I think this is my new favorite location! I definitely cannot wait to come back and please open a location in Glendale!

Lukewarm hibachi experience.    The fried rice is pre-made,  not prepared on the grill.   Also,  our chef chopped up the shrimp (I suspect to give the illusion you're getting more).    I ordered shrimp/chicken hibachi and  all of my shrimp was chopped up like "kibbles and bits" dog food.   (Do you really have to chop up medium sized shrimp, geeez aren't  they already shrimp??).   Also. The veggies were significantly over cooked.   The chicken was good.   On the other hand, Kyoto has superior customer service; when I discovered my fork was dirty (hard white material) they promptly brought me another one.

* Kyoto * - This used to be our "go-to" sushi place when we were in College.  Literally a sushi roll stuffed with quality fish was $2.99.

Fast forward 20 years and; as expected, the prices have grown with inflation significantly.  The quality is still decent, but lacks imagination.  I am not sure if that is good or bad.  Many sushi restaurants are getting a little to creative for my liking.  I prefer standards like "Maki, Sashimi or Hand Rolls".

Kyoto is a good time and should be experienced at least once.  The bar gets quite crowded and they also do Teppanyaki which is very popular.  So, if you want to avoid the crowds, hit them up for lunch; or, dinner Sunday - Wednesday.

They are located right in the heart of Old-Town; so, go eat some decent sushi then stroll around town and see what kind of trouble you can stay out of!

Food was good, service was terrible. Initial service was good but then the server disappeared for a good 30 minutes. I had to get up and ask her to come to our table to take additional drink orders (and I also let her know we hadn't gotten our salads yet and we were already eating our entrees).  This place needs serious attention when it comes to service. These things are such easy fixes, get 1-2 more people helping. While I was waiting for my fiancé to get out of the bathroom, I heard to coworkers ranting about how someone complained about the service.

I knew about this place when I asked a co-worker who lives in the area.  The first time I tried it was great. I talked to to authentic japanese sushi chef and he made Omakase (chef special ) for me. I think he was very good because the second time my coworker and I went again it was another guy cuttnig up the fish. He wasn't very good so I didn't enjoy it. 
SO it depends on the chef......

I have been going here for a VERY long time. They recently went through an ownership change and renovation. IT IS AWESOME. The food is great; fresh, and Oishee des.

If you stopped going while it was closed, give it another try...You wont be disappointed

I had never been to a tappenaki restaurant before, but I was invited to a birthday party here tonight and it was my first experience! I really enjoyed it, it was a fun time. I thought about ordering the tofu but for $18 I didn't think it would be worth it since I wouldn't have anyone to share my meal with and I was not super hungry.
The service there was great, they were super accommodating to me being a vegetarian. They cooked the vegetables away from the meat for me which was really nice! The vegetables were delicious too, a lot of my fave veggies in that mix!
As my meal I ended up just getting a veggie roll. It was very tasty, I haven't had too much veggie sushi before, but I liked this quite a bit! I was surprised at how full I was when I left because it didn't seem like that much food, but I was filled up for sure. I would come back, it's really awesome how long it has been there too!

One of my old-school stand out favorites.  Have been coming here for at least 10 years if not more.  The owner is always there and friendly.  (Always thanks you for coming in no less).  For lunch they have amazing bento box lunches for under 6.00 dollars.  If you crave teppan, they have old school teppan dinners where you can see your food aflame and cooked for you.  If it were closer to downtown Phoenix I would be parked here.  I like to see that it refuses to change as the rest of Scottsdale becomes trendier....I love that it hasn't changed and that the quality of food and service is still great.  
For dinner its going to be old-school, i.e. not trendy and nothing challenging.  This place did have its heydey about ten years ago, but that said, its comforting and good.

I must confess i have only been here for Lunch, but it is one of the best deals in town for Lunch.  My friend and i just ate there and had Chicken teriyaki, white rice, salad, 2 sushi rolls and a squid salad and only paid $13 each...I mean c'mon-that's pretty hard to beat.  Just the Chicken w rice and salad is $3.50 and it's so filing and delicious! Would recommend it to anyone who likes a filling tasty meal for a cheap price.
I've been to Kyoto about 100 times for lunch, and I've never been disappointed.  Great prices, and a very friendly staff.

For the price this place is awesome.  The service you may find a bit slow, but if your not a scottsdale brat, and dont expect someone else to wipe your ass for you, you will love this place.  The lunch prices are unreal, and I've taken my kids here for there birthday at the teppanyaki tables - which we all loved.  The sushi is better than Ra for the price in my opinion.  So let me say again if you're not a snobby scottsdale brat you will indeed love this place.
Great food, great service , and at an awesome location . Price have increased dramatically here in the last 6-9 months ... thus the 4 stars.

I went last night as a party of three. First visit for two of us. Three takeaways: food was just okay, filet mignon was not worth it and service was poor. Emphasis on the latter.

Food was what you may expect at a place like this - salty. So you're just bloated after the meal from all the sodium. Not their fault, but just the style of teppanyaki. The filet mignon didn't particularly do it for me, but it is a better piece of meat than the NY Strip so you can make you're own call there.

Service was just really poor. Our reservation was late getting started by about 20 minutes, but I wasn't really all that upset - some patrons take longer than others, I get it. But once we sat down, it took more than ten minutes for a server to come take our drink order. Enough time for the manager to come apologize and introduce her to us. We just got sodas that were never refilled throughout the meal until one of us asked for a refill. I don't think they would have ever noticed and it wasn't as if just one person was coming around. There was the server, two different food runners with water and the manager.

And then the final bit of disappointment was the rice coming out. I was halfway done with my meal before the rice ever made it. The other party at our table received theirs from a food runner and he looked at us and I said "three steamed," he acknowledged and appeared to go in the kitchen to retrieve three orders of white rice. Five more minutes go by and the server comes out to ask if all is going well and I let her know that we still don't have our rice. She goes and retrieves it immediately and once again, the manager comes out to apologize for the service.

I just felt from the beginning that our table in particular may have been an afterthought. I can tell that was observed at least to some degree by the staff with the two apologies from the manager. It might not be that way for everyone as I certainly hope the manager isn't walking around apologizing all evening.

If you're wanting a nice dinner out with friends, you can fare better at other options nearby for the same price point.

I go a few times a week for lunch, which is very inexpensive.  For $3.75 you get a nice assortment of tempura vegetables and fish, small salad, and a little ball of rice.  It's just the right amount of food for lunch and you absolutely cannot find anything cheaper nearby.
Definitely one of the best sushi restaurants I have been to in Scottsdale, AZ.  Rivals some of the sushi restaurants back in San Diego, CA..

I've been to Kyoto a handful of times through the years... it's an Old Town Scottsdale staple.  Whether you're looking for sushi or hibachi; you're dining solo or with a group; you can find what you're looking for here, but you do have to choose between the sushi side and the hibachi side of the restaurant.

I've been for both and neither has blown me away, but if you don't have extremely high expectations, this place really is A-OK.  Service is attentive and somewhat quick.  Prices are moderate, but if you're eating sushi, it can add up quickly!

I do like Kyoto as it's not your typical Old Town scene; it's a bit on the older and more casual side, which I like.

Some highlights from my last meal (and keep in mind that I'm pregnant, so I had to go with all cooked fish this time):
-edamame
-salad with japanese dressing
-futomaki roll
-caterpillar roll

While I'm not rushing back, I don't think Kyoto is going anywhere, so I imagine I'll be returning eventually.  Remember, it's A-OK as long as you don't have high expectations.  Enjoy!

It's been a while. Ok..... Still impressed with the pricing. Affordable for sure. I like the re model. Thought they were building a patio, but maybe not. New windows were cool. Not sure how to describe the service. Server, blah and I mean pretty blah. Doesn't mean she did a bad job. Just blah. Can Kyoto invest in server uniforms? We still had a good time. Will be back. Hope they will take a hard look at the service that they provide.
Great service, great food, greater prices. I always sit at the sushi bar and they've remembered me since my first time in. 5/5!

Went here for a girlfriend's Bachelorette weekend - So fun!  But then again, we'd have fun at a gas station.  It was about 100 degrees out at night - and there were many a dude sportin' fancy, expensive convertibles driving by (possibly hoping to pick up a drunk bachelorette?) - parts of Scottsdale ooze money.  Good food & drinks.

My life has never been the same since Ayako of Tokyo located at the Biltmore Fashion Park was shut down. However, Kyoto of Scottsdale has to be the next best thing for Sushi and Saki B's. While the trendy "A Crowds" are dumping loads of cash on high priced drinks, mediocre sushi and snobby service, I am stuffing my face silly at Kyoto. Don't expect fancy frills here just damn good and inexpensive eats.  Itadakimasu

While I'm a sushi fan, my husband is a sushi FIEND - we made biweekly trips to his favorite haunt in NYC (Monster Sushi) and if he was on his own for dinner, I could always count on him to be there for a bite.  After relocating to Phoenix, he'd been jonesing hardcore for non-commercial, non-fussy sushi in epic proportions served with a smile.  Our trusted source told us that Kyoto was their favorite and we had to indulge.  The mixed views on Yelp made be a tad nervous, but I like to give places an unbiased chance.  Very glad that I did.

The interior of the place is a little strange given the shape of the restaurant and lack of windows, but we made ourselves cozy in a table next to the sushi bar.  I also did not notice a pre-club atmosphere - it was chill the night we went, but maybe it was because we went after work (which is probably on the earlier side for the see and be seens).

No teppan for us that night - it was all about the sushi.  We started with a pleasantly savory miso soup, flavorful seaweed salad and moist, tender tako (octopus) salad.  Next was my favorite dish of the night (and no, not traditional for sushi, but whatever) - a peppered, seared tuna with onion sauce.  Divine!  I could have had three plates of this and called it a day.  Most of the folks in our party ordered rather classic rolls, while I ordered an additional three specialty rolls (Candy Cane, Ichi and Shrimp Tempura - I love to crunch it out).  The rolls were so HUGE we struggled to eat it all.  Keep in mind that those specialty rolls are massive, particularly the Ichi (should have been called Ichi the Killer Roll) which you could barely eat with chopsticks.  I was a mess of dungeoness crab and spicy tuna by the end of the night, but I was happy.

Price was absolutely fair for the quality of the food - there are many (MANY) overprices sushi places in Scottsdale and many dirt cheap places in the valley.  This one charges fairly and keeps the quality up.  I don't ever mind paying if it's worth it.

Will most definitely come back and hopefully take in some teppan next time :)
Awesome lunch specials for crazy cheap.  Greta sushi as well. Never had a bad experience.
The food is very good, but service is horrible. The waitress was concerned on carrying a conversation with the cook, than serving us.
Awesome and QUICK service plus prices are great.

Don't come here service sucks and so does the food the tablet they take online orders with wasn't charged had to wait twenty extra minutes bfor my take out chicken teriyaki had no chicken sushi was ok but hostess attitude was garbage done with this place

I never Yelp review but this place is too good not to! First off food is absolutely delicious and don't even get me started on the sake. Service and management are some of the best you will receive. Manager Jesus is not only professional but truly understands the quality of everything to be the best. Would highly recommend for date night or drinks with the boys/girls. Friday tradition has been going strong for 5 weeks now!

Really?  Teriyaki Chicken with a side salad and rice for $3.50?  Oh, and its good?  Seriously?  I was amazed at how cheap their lunch specials are and even more amazed that it was actually quite good.  The chicken was soft moist white meat with a tasty teriyaki sauce and mushrooms.  I really enjoyed the sauce, because it wasn't sickeningly sweet or heavy.  The salad was as simple as they come... just some iceberg lettuce with a surprisingly flavorful dressing.  I am not sure what the dressing was made of, but my best guess is some combination of peanut, soy and ginger.  Very tasty!  It was really the perfect amount of food for the lunch hour.  I walked away full and satisfied, but not so full that I had to fight the post-lunch food coma.

Kyoto is now one of my favorite restaurants. I took a date there late on a Saturday night - it was perfect! The food was delicious, the cook entertaining, and the ambiance unique. I will definitely be coming back.

5 stars for lunch options and value, 2.5 stars for lunchtime sushi.
4 stars for dinner, 4 stars for dinner sushi.

This place has two faces - a simple and incredible value during lunch (4$ tasty lunch bento boxes...are you KIDDING?), and then a full blown, non-corporate teppan-yaki at night.

I definitely tend to notice a difference in the quality of the sushi between lunch and dinner with the latter being preferable.  Dinner options are delicious and great fun, but the amazing dimension Kyoto brings to downtown Scottsdale are its lunch offerings.  Seriously, they're good, and under 5 bucks.  That alone makes it worth the trip!

Absolutely loved this place! Staff is super friendly and management is great. Loved the food and the vibe of Kyoto. My boyfriend is not a fan of sushi but there were plenty of items he enjoyed off the menu. Will definitely return!

The only sushi place I go to during non happy hour times.  The sushi here is really good and affordable.  I highly recommend trying this place out.
