I would give it 5 stars however the wait on a Saturday night was over an hour and staff at the time look like they could be working at a Texas BBQ place (not an insult, as they were friendly but just unexpected for a Japanese restaurant.)

I've been going here for almost a decade now.  I love it.  Great prices, great sushi, great chefs.  They have lots of ingredients, including some of the more rare ones like kampyo.  I almost always order a couple of rolls made "my way"...all veggies!  YUM!!!!

We had a huge birthday party here for a friend. We took up the entire right side of the restaurant. The plumb wine was great. I had the sashimi and a roll and i regret it. I ate wayyy too much. 

This place is pretty nice but I like some other options in the area a little better. There are a lot of sushi options in the scottsdale area. The best sushi place I had in the valley had to be near Ahwatukee.
The sushi was bomb but the sashim was so bad I actually did vomit in their bathroom the squid was not fresh at all and the hamachi was sour tasting.

One of my favorite spots in in town. The good it's always good and the service is tops. I recommend the salmon volcano roll if you are on a date. She will be impressed when that comes out. The parking has valet do that's another plus for dates. Me and my girlfriend did the teppan so I recommend that cause the chefs are really skilled and the food is delicious. The price for this place is very reasonable since you are in Scottsdale. Guys if you need a place to go and want to impress your date go here.

Best sushi in Old Town.  A part of me does not want to give Kyoto great reviews in fear that it'll take me a few more minutes to get my sushi fix.  For the first 2 years living in Old Town I thought this place was closed down.  The shutters are always closed and looks dark in the outside but I'm very happy to find it open.  I've only had the sushi and not the tepenyaki.  Like what others said, prices are very good for Old Town and quality is good.  It's 10,000 times better than Ra.  Granted the atmosphere isn't hip but you're there for the sushi, right?  If you want atmosphere go to Ra.

They say Sushi bars are more about the decor and the swag than the food and boy did this lovely place in old town Scottsdale live up to the expectation! Our itamae (chef) was very pleasant and delightful. He kept cracking jokes whilst showing excellent skills with the fork and the slotted spoon. The menus is good with decent prices. We had 2 rolls, 2 chicken entrees and 3 drinks for $45. I felt the food was mediocre but I'd overlook that in lieu of the wholesome experience, plus I am not a huge fan of sushi anyway. All in all, it was an awesome experience and I would recommend this as a must try for a night of dining fun!

Can't believe I haven't written a review for Kyoto - I used to go to this place at least 3 times a week when I worked in Old Town Scottsdale.

I've only been there for lunch, and you can't get a better deal.  I would order the #3 lunch special - Chicken Teriyaki & Rice - for $3.50.  Yeah, you read that right...$3.50.  You get chicken, rice, salad, & a few orange wedges - perfect portion for lunch, and it's almost cheaper than bringing your own lunch to work!

The only downside to this place is that if you get there a little after noon for lunch, the service slows WAY down.  I once waited nearly an hour for my food when other times it was out in as little as 10 minutes.  I know places get busy, but they are always busy for lunch, so I'm not sure why they haven't figured that out yet.

They have other items on their lunch menu which includes some sushi, pork, and of couse some more chicken variations.  HIGHLY recommended if you are in Old Town Scottsdale for lunch!
Best fried rice in town! Been coming here for years and the new ownership didn't miss a beat. Same authentic feel and the sushi was very fresh. Again, hands down the best fried rice I've ever had!

$6 pint of Kirin and sake.  Sake bombs galore!!!  This is their doorbuster deal to attract customers.  It really works because I see every table have several orders of these (multiple by 5 if college students).  This deal is 5 stars alone!

Onto the next important topic: Teppanyaki.  This is the other main attraction at this establishment.  I'd say it's 90% show and 10% taste.  The show is outstanding.  I've been to a few of these teppanyaki restaurants and Kyoto receives the best award for being the most entertaining.  Unfortunately, the food is less desirable.  A medium rare steak is overcooked and without flavor even when sprinkled with their seasoning.  The chicken is dry even with the sauce glazed on top of it.  The scallop and lobster were meh too.

Overall, the $6 sake and teppanyaki showmanship will make a great night with friends.

Take the word "bowl" away, and it goes from crap to awesome.   

Very Benihana in nature, but I thought the food was superior to Benihana, and, best of all, $4 for a 22oz Kieren and sake.  Awesome deal.   

Of course, the table-side entertainment was fun.  They set the table on fire and made a volcano out of an onion.  Fun stuff.

I am so done with this place, it is truly a dump. The coworkers love it for some reason and I think it's mostly the lunch prices. You get what you pay for. Dust on the windowsills. The dishes they serve the sushi on look like they fished them from a dumpster.  I've tried the sushi, the teppan, and the bento style lunches. All were unremarkable. If all you care about is a cheap lunch, by all means go here. I will not be returning.

So happy this place reopened!  They're under new management and I am l loving the changes that have been implemented.  We took advantage of the hibachi table and our chef, Ivan, was not only professional and pleasant but I couldn't put down my fork.  I was already in deep with a food comma but I just couldn't stop.  I had the chicken and my boyfriend had the lobster, both excellent.  That fried rice though... nom.  We also had a couple of sake flights.  The desert sake flight was my favorite, I didn't even know pear flavored sake existed.  You can't go wrong coming here from the sushi to hibachi you will love the experience.

Great sushi for a very reasonable price, my friends and I love going here. Although on the weekends the wait can be very long and the small bar overfilled with patrons. The host could be a bit more friendly, but we've been willing to overlook that for the food.

I was hoping that they would've revived this place.  The music is 80's, the photos on the wall are 80's and stop with the 10 TV's non-stop showing pictures of your food!  So tacky.  The floors are greasy and the smell of the grill is terrible.  The food is fair,  but super salty!  The staff was very sweet and they tried really hard.  This place could be a goldmine with better management.  Perfect location...would love to see it turn around!

This place rocks for Sushi and for saki bombs. It isn't the best sushi I have had, but it does the job whenever we are in scottsdale. The service is really good. They have a lot of choices for sushi lovers! The wait sort of stinks during the busy hours, so keep that in mind.

Worst experience ever! Once walking in it took waiter 15 min to even talk to use. We then ordered our main course and that took 30 min to get to us While waiting to get our main course we ordered a sushi roll. Then we received our main course after being there 40 min. My chicken also had a bone in it when I was eating it. Then waited for sushi for a hour and a half after being there. Then decide to just cancel the order because it took so long to get the sushi. The portions were small and not filling. I would much rather go to any other sushi place than this one. Will not be going back ever especially since I drove two hours to come try it.

Great little place. Good service and good show

Had teppanyaki - always good

Can't speak to the sushi.

I actually don't care if the food is good at this point, the service sucks. From the minute I walked in to this very moment this shit sucks. Went to the bar to order a drink because nobody took my order at the table and the bartender told me it wasn't happy hour. The menu clearly says happy hour from 9p-close. After he realizes that it's happy hour, he fails to give me my change. Yeah I would never ever return here again

Got to revise my review. Wrote a few months ago that the quality had slipped, but they are back to their old strength, and then some. Awesome sashimi! Besides the usual (tuna, yellowtail etc,), they had Marlin and Mahi today - wow!
Service has always been great, by the way.

Should have learned my lesson the first time after I ordered a noodle dish and they prepared it with the wrong noodles because they were out of the proper kind. Just received a postmates order for lunch, I ordered the Chicken teriyaki bento box. The chicken was a frozen chicken breast that had those fake grill marks on it, not appetizing whatsoever. Never Again!

Went here for fathers day with my husband, 3 kids and two other adults. At first we were slightly frustrated because we had a reservation and still had to wait about 20 min, not as easy a task with 3 tiny humans. However, once we were seated they more than made up for it. I asked the hostess for some plain paper and pencils for the kids to draw on and she was more than happy to help out. The other staff brought out little chopstick helpers which the kids were thrilled they could use chopsticks for their food. The chef, which I think is the reason why we had to wait was for him - was TOTALLY worth it. He entertained the kids and even cut up their food "Mini" size, which is GREAT when you want to eat and you don't have to spend time cutting up their meat or veggies to smaller pieces. He even gave us some extra fire at the end per the kids request. The staff then brought out little light up heart necklaces for the kids too - which just made the night even more memorable. It was a wonderful dinner and fathers day and was great for the kids who were soooo entertained, we had just a great time. 

As for the food - it was great, cooked how we liked it, well seasoned and well priced. The staff was on point making sure we had everything we needed, never ran out of water or drinks - they were extremely accommodating. This place would work for a different night out with adults or definitely if you have kids because they are well entertained. Already planning on taking them again for a fun dinner out.

I haven't visited for lunch - which apparently I am missing out on based on the reviews below! 

Anyway, I have been twice for a dinner and it has been sub-par.  Most recently I visited this past weekend 8/24/13.  Sure, they may have the cool fire and loud, clanging spatulas - but it seems like more gimmicky than anything; I would take Benihana over Kyoto any day. Also, the staff we had both times were also sub-par.... which truly fulfills the need for this restaurant to be rated "Meh. I've experienced better."

Some have called Kyoto a classic in terms of a true Scottsdale tradition. 

I happen to be a friend of some guys who have sent their daughters to ASU and everything about that tradition loses all of it's appeal once your age hits 29 or your IQ hits 101.  If Scottsdale can be said to be full of people who either live at Club Med or work for Club Med, Kyoto is their kind of place. Loud, cute, semi-drunk and more impressed with itself than anyone ought to be.

That said, just like most trust fund girls, all the teeth are straight and the diction is perfect. It's all very wholesome and lovely, but something about it just strikes you as a bit too..hmm how shall we say.. brightly colored. If you happen to be a man who has survived any one of the four great tests of American manhood (child custody, IRS trouble, felony conviction or heart attack), then this is the kind of place you should avoid. That is because it is chock full of people whose idea of grave danger is being unable to BS their way out of a DUI ticket. If you frown in here, or order whiskey, they're like "Dude, what's with him?"

So my advice to the gentlemen of age and wisdom is to steer clear, if only because you're going to find yourself staring very hard at women young enough to be your (dumbass) daughter, and that's a very icky feeling. 

On the other hand, if you answer to 'dude', all I can say is "Duuuuude!"

Love Love Love Kyoto Lunch! Consistently Excellent! Have been going there for years.
Keep up the great job Kyoto Japanese Restaurant .
Kyoto is one of my two favorite sushi venues in the valley (the other being Sakana).  Very good sushi, great portions, and decent prices.  I like how it's never about "the scene" here.
Still one of my favorite places for Sushi and Sake.  Sushi was great and portion sizes were just right.  Everything is inexpensive and the atmosphere is fun.

I'm giving 5 stars only because it won't let me leave 10 stars. This hidden gem had incredible staff and customer service. Eveytime I come I Feel so welcomed. The food is delicious! Eric is amazing and so hospitable. I would recommend this place to anyone.
Some of the best sushi I've ever had. Their dynamite dish is excellent! And so is their fried rice. All in all everything was really good though. Great service as well.
Terrible, server was rude.  No yum yum sauce. No flavor at all. Miso soup was very salty, as was the ginger dressing. Will never return

We've now dined here a few times the past couple of years during our Scottsdale vacations. We keep giving it another try. The 1st time was not bad. Each time since, it has become progressively worse. I'm sorry, but the food has been below mediocre in our most recent visits.
For example, on our last visit a week ago, the taste and the texture of some of the sushi rolls was dreadful--like they had been made at some earlier time and had been sitting in a refrigerator for a quite a while. Another roll--one of their specials--just tasted like a gob of mayonnaise. In yet another specialty roll, the shrimp tempura within was stale and tasteless and overdone.
Well, we have now given up on this place.
To be fair, my rainbow roll was very good, and the sake flight--as well as the fellow who presented and discussed it--was excellent.
But overall, this place is much much inferior to the several Japanese restaurants we frequent--in several different states.

One of my favorite places to get sushi in Arizona.  Their prices are very reasonable and the sushi is very fresh.  The cooking table is fun too if you'd rather have some cooked stir-fry type food.  I'd recommend eating there before 7 pm, because it gets really crowded anytime after that.
This is my favorite sushi/teppan place to go! I'm so happy they have re-opened!! Our dinner last night was great as always. I highly recommend the crazy roll.

i eat a lot of sushi and teppan. this is one of, if not the best sushi/teppanyaki joint in phx.

the sushi is meaty and delicious and well-priced. not fishy tasting at all ("fishy" means "not fresh"). the only negative is their selection is lacking a bit.

the teppanyaki may be the best of any places i have been to. soup and salad come with the meal. the soup is not miso soup and i dont really care for it. the salad on the other hand . . . best citrus-ginger dressing of any japanese restaurant. the filet is seriously like butter. only thing is, there is no filet + scallops combo -- you have to get the ny strip to get the combo. i suppose you can ask but i didnt. the only other negative is that they do not make the fried rice at your table, they just bring you a bowl of it from the kitchen. come on, thats part of the draw of teppan!

also, their lunch is amazing! for less than $4, you get a box lunch with entree/meat, salad, rice and orange slices. best deal in scottsdale. wish i still worked across the street.

this review is for their lunch. One of the best values hidden in old town Scottsdale. I had their sashimi plater. for $8 you got 9 pieces of fresh sashimi, rice and salad. I have also tried their kautsu lunch and that is a steal as well.

This place is a treasure in Old Town Scottsdale! Consider yourself lucky if you need a cheap lunch in Scottsdale because this is as good as it gets! 

I LOVE their sushi and lunch specials. $3.95 for a full chicken terriyaki lunch, with salad!! I guess they don't believe in inflation? These prices cannot be found anywhere else...ESPECIALLY NOT in old town. 

Their rolls are unbelievably cheap too! I had an order of oysters one day and it was...AMAZING! Once again...cheap oysters that are fresh and served on a plate of ice. What more can you ask for?

Deliciousness - 3/5
Happiness - 1/5

It is so disappointing how bad this place is as I love teppanyaki cooking and the show that goes with it. And the food here is just fine. The fried rice is tasty and not greasy. The meats were cooked to perfection, though I could have used a bit more flavoring. And the price is reasonable enough ($30-50 for the teppanyaki options). 

But the show was lacking for sure. The cook simply refused to interact with the table, not even answering questions. I am partially paying a premium for the show, and there just wasn't a show to be had. A few flips of cutlery at the beginning and then he had his eyes glued to the grill after that. It also took about 30 minutes from ordering for the cooking to begin, that's a long time to wait.

And then, the payment was a mess. We were a party of four. One of us paid $40, one of us paid $50, and the other two paid over $150.00. Why? We have no idea. The restaurant failed to give a detailed receipt of what could have led to such disparity in the bills, let alone two bills over $150.00. We then discovered that they ran our cards multiple times for differing amounts. And we received no apologies, no explanation, and just brusque answers to why they kept taking our cards. I remain convinced that they charged the entire table to the four of us, even though we were not there with the others dining at the table. When I asked to speak to a manager, they just gave me the restaurant's phone number and said to call back later. 

I'd recommend going to a happier place for the experience than Kyoto.

My husband and i have visited Kyoto many times prior to the recent closing.  We were very excited to return as our experiences have always been positive.  What a disappointment!  I ordered a Grey Goose vodka martini;  they did not have Grey Goose nor any premium vodka.  The fried rice was brought from the kitchen rather then made on the teppenyaki table and was tasteless.  We ordered scallops (received 2) and the chicken and steak were just ok, certainly not worthy of the $38.00+ cost. The chef, although nice enough, did not have the skill to pull off this type of cooking. ..
Sushi rolls are decent. The salad you get with lunch is chunks of iceberg lettuce. Portions for lunch are good
Yummy!!!! We really enjoyed our visit - didn't realize Kyoto's had been closed for two years and had only recently reopened two months prior. Very enjoyable!

My wife and I enjoyed our dining experience at Kyoto, and although there was nothing significant to complain about, it just didn't offer the flare and excitement of some of the Hibachi/Teppanyaki dinners we are used to. The building is aged and decor is dated, which takes nothing away from the quality of food, but unfortunately doesn't do much to contribute to the ambience. 

The chef's performance was a highlight, he was talkative and efficient and funny, just as we would expect. Unfortunately the food was just different from what we are used to. Fried rice wasn't as buttery and soft, and the veggies were just too "mixed". I suppose we may just be guilty of enjoying our southern, buttery, goodness from the Carolinas. 

Overall, Kyoto provided us a good dining experience, just not at the top of our "must dine at again" list.
Amazing service. Very accommodating and awesome sushi roll.  really loved the spicy tuna roll, vegetable rolls, and crispy shrimp appetizer

Went during the day yesterday and was reminded why I don't do that more often. The lunch special was cheap, but shrimp and whitefish lacked the whitefish and was basically just deep fried slices of potato and carrot. The sushi was dogshit and the service was worse. 

Getting menus was a chore, the edimame had no salt on it and when I asked for a side of salt, they brought me another shaker of table salt... what kind of place serves edimame and doesn't have sea salt or kosher salt? We drank a lot of saki bombers just to cope with the horrible food and service. Their saki smelled like nailpolish remover, but we couldn't tell when we mixed it with beer... anyway, it got the job done.

Every time I've tried to go here for dinner, they are packed and the wait is an hour. The staff is rude also. Silly me, I'm such an asshole for wanting to eat at your shitty restaurant.

As a sushi joint, this place blows - especially with so many better places within walking distance... including Ra (yes, Ra is better). On the other hand, as a tapanyaki restaurant, this place is pretty good. I suggest making reservations with a large group. It's not the best place for this either, but it's decent and conveniently located.

Kyoto has been around for ages and I've always recommended it to friends. Truth is, this place isn't so special. Never has been. It's possible to go here and have a great time and decent food, but there are more reliable places around.

"Real Japanese cuisine"  
For all those that think Teppan style is authentic Japanese food I hope my yelp opens your eyes.
 Don't get me wrong I love to eat with a group of friends at Kyoto.  But know that the Teppan style cooking is an authentic tourist trap created by a chain restaurant owner in Japan.  

The Review

I like the Kyoto bowl for but a good Japanese food.  The chiefs create a great experience and atmosphere and the Sushi is pretty good.  I have eaten here a few times, and have had a saki bomb here or there. I learned the hard way how power full the drinks are so use with caution.

Had an issue with cross-contamination of foods on the Teppanyaki grill, which caused me to get e-coli. I was very sick the night after. 

I had the steak and shrimp. My steak was cooked next to someone's chicken. Additionally, the steak was very cold when it was served to me. 

When I spoke with friends about my experience, they told me that they either had the same issues or knew of others who got ill. 

My suggestion is to go to Benihana instead if you are craving Teppanyaki style Japanese cuisine

Probably wouldn't return. We were pleasantly surprised on Saturday night when we called and the had Teppanyaki table available for 2 at 8 pm (only 1 hour from when I called). When we arrived at 745 we gave our name and the hostess looked for us and clearly didn't find our name but said "we will seat you closer to your reservation". We grabbed drinks at the bar... bartender was fun, talkative, and never let our drinks get low. The bar area was very crowded and not comfortable area to sit long term. At 830 the hostess came to get us and it was much more apparent they hadn't written down our reservation as they attempted to sit us with a full table in the corner up against a bookshelf. The hostess realized this was not going to work and sat us solo at a grill. We then waited until 940 for our chef to come to us. The show was half as exciting as everyone around us. My filet was over cooked and the other food was sub par.

Great place for lunch! The price and the quality is excellent. It is not the best sushi in the area, but the lunch menu is very cheap and has some good options. They offer different teriyaki meals that come with rice and a salad for around 5 dollars. It is also pretty filling and sometimes I will get a roll or two to go with it. 

When going for lunch the service is usually pretty good. There can be a longer wait at night and the prices go up, so I would definitely suggest trying out Kyoto for lunch if you are in the area.

So, we sat at a teppanyaki table, which seats like 12 people. So, they don't do separate checks but force you to split it into 4 checks at most. And then, they screw it up by putting some things on one bill and then other things from the same person on a completely different bill. So, if you don't want to spend an hour on your Friday night while people try to figure out who owes who what and trying to get the server to give you a bill that's even slightly close to correct, well, then don't.

The food is fine, about the same as Hon Machi in Chandler, or that place on Elliott in Ahwatukee.

They get two stars because when I pay money, I'm paying for service. Otherwise, I can stay home. There's a reason McDonalds is cheap ... it's because you're not paying for service.

I love this place.  The food and the chef were great!  But even with new owner, the restaurant hasn't changed or been updated in 20 years.  
It could use an update.  
A modern overhaul with the same food would serve this place well.
It may be "iconic" for Scottsdale but that beaten down look, won't draw people in.

There is something about Yelp that compels me to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth, so help me God.  So before I get to the bad, I'll tell you about the good. Kyoto is so fun.  I've been going there for years and it's pretty much a guaranteed good time- especially if you sit at a cooking table.  Keep in mind that the cooking tables really fill up quickly, so if you're looking to get one for a larger party for a Friday or Saturday night, you definitely need to get that reservation in early on in the week. Smaller parties can usually be squeezed in to the tables without thaaat long of a wait.  

The environment is always lively at Kyoto- maybe it's the sake...I don't really know. But this is definitely not the spot for a quiet, romantic dinner.  People are always yelling, laughing and talking very loudly here and it's often the scene for birthday and graduation celebrations.

In fact, when it's your birthday, they bring out something I can only describe as a washcloth shaped weener with a cherry on top. They also sing and give you a coffee mug that has pictures of sushi all around it.  

I got this mug a few years ago and after a few shots, found it so funny that I became absolutely determined not to lose it during the night ahead of me. I somehow (and I say this with great pride) kept that mug in my bag the whole night and still have it today.  

I think the food is good at Kyoto too and the sushi is pretty decent.  But the fried rice is what dreams are made of.  Try it and you'll know what I mean. My best friend and I used to go to Kyoto some nights before we went out and sit at the bar with a drink in one hand and a bowl of fried rice in the other. Forget the cooking tables- that's all we needed. 

Now I have to end this review on a bad note, but keep in mind that although it took me about a year to return after the 'incident,' I still did return nonetheless and still go to Kyoto on occasion.  This happened probably five years ago, but I will never forget it. My friend and I ordered sake and were pouring it into the little sake glass when we noticed something black had poured out with it.  A horrified little peak into the glass revealed it was a large, hideous roach! AAAAARGH. It still freaks me out. The glass was thrown and we made quite a scene, but upon telling the bartender, the only response he gave back to us was "well, was it alive?" DOES IT MATTER? 

He comped us two gin and tonics and sent us on our way and that was that.  I know from working in the service industry that all restaurants and clubs have roaches, it's just a fact of life. You can do your best to maintain it, but those little bastards keep on coming. I don't completely blame Kyoto or think the place is infested with roaches but it still was a little traumatizing for someone that is deathly afraid of those hideous monsters.  It took me awhile to return, but I still go, I just won't order the sake. If you do, please do me a favor and look in the little sake bottle before you pour it.

Stopped by for some sushi in old town at this place on the corner...had reservation at 10 pm but they sat us down at 850 pm (not at teppanyaki table) which we wanted sushi anyways. Their baseline products were very fresh and very good!! Started with their Hakushika sake which we had 3 bottles...was really really good and went well with their sushi!! Started with their soft shell crab and it was amazing!! Their salmon was fresh, beef sashimi was spicy and unbelievable!!  I would come back for that alone!! The albacore was really fresh...the uni was super fresh!!! When everything came out it was really pleasing!! I honestly will come back to bring my dad for the beef sashimi...different and amazing!!
Fish was fresh-new sushi eater loved the candy cane roll!  Friends found the having to write the order ourselves weird.

I've been going to Kyoto for years. This place is great for lunch. Good food at a great price. Very low prices considering it's in Old Town Scottsdale. They'll even let you take out sushi unless it's a zillion degrees and your health may be at risk. Try any of the generous lunch specials, which come with rice and salad.

At night, try the saki bombers at a low price before you take off to the other bars. It's a great way to get your night started.

This place is excellent price wise and has a decent variety. My only complaint is the setup of the seating...check it out...

ABRA...

Food was great, chef was great but the waitress was awful. The place was not busy at all and we never got refills from the server, never got asked by the server how our meal was, and we're given the bill until 40 minutes after we were done eating. It was brought by another server.

3.5 stars! After eating Pure Sushi, I'd say it doesn't have the freshest raw sushi -- and it doesn't have the best Americanized sushi. I did like the caterpillar roll as well as the tuna belly nigiri. The fried rice was tasty, however, because I like spicy, I'd add some Siracha to add an extra kick to it. It makes me crave tomato fried rice. The scallops were also good, however, I've had better ones at Roka Akor (although the one here is better priced for sure!) My other friends love this place. I think if I come here again, I'd opt to get the Salmon volcano roll -- I hear it is superb!

Bad...very bad.  Went to this place for dinner on a Sunday night.  I felt pretty comfortable when I saw how crowded it was inside.  It doesn't look like much on the outside.

The sushi tasted pretty good, and it was cheap.  One of my dining partners and I both suffered the next day though.  I felt like crud.

I don't know what it was that got me but I suggest you run, don't walk, away.  I should have known that cheap sushi is generally (not always) cheap for a reason.

The BEST sashimi in the valley! Ask for belly-cut yellowtail; so tender and juicy! They also have teppan tables that are fun to sit at if you're with a big party. The filet and scallops are delicious, the marinade compliments both of them. There can be long waits on the weekends, but it's definitely worth it!

Cheapest bento box lunch I've ever seen. Under $4??? And $6 for a sashimi bento box which includes 9 pieces of decent sashimi (3 tuna, 3 salmon, 3 yellowtail). Such amazing prices! 
Boyfriend likes the fish katsu, which reminds me of nicer fish sticks, and I had the pork katsu which was not bad, but not amazing. Next time I would get the teriyaki or just the sashimi. Overall, very nice service  - they had no problems splitting our tab with the other person we went to lunch with - and pretty decent food for the price. Definitely a great choice for a cheap and filling lunch.

My home away from home....seriously!  I used to eat here three times a week when I lived in AZ.  The owner/service is grrrrreat!!  They treat everyone like family :).   Definitely come here if you love sushi!  For larger parties and events, they also have Teppanyaki in the back room.  

Their menu is soooo reasonably priced and absolutely delcious!! My friends and I would come here before going out as well....can't pass up the $4 saki bomber specials...!!!!

Teppanyaki seating with eight, 4 adults and 4 kids. From reviews, realized restaurant was just re opened a couple weeks ago. Redone dining room with some minor cosmetic updates. Never went to this place prior, but seems like a slight update. Entertainment from "chef" was a bit light. Not as embellished as expected. No real theatrics and did not make fried rice at table, came from kitchen in bowl. Seemed a bit out of sequence, salad and soup at same time, then shrimp app, vegetables, then seafood, then proteins. No ice cream at end, we may be spoiled at the  restaurant we go to at home. Food was all ok, nothing overly memorable.

Great place for hibachi and definitely worth a try for their sushi. The tables can get a little tight with a big group,  so be prepared to get really cozy with your neighbors. The chefs are awesome and highly entertaining. Sushi chefs definitely know what they are doing and the bartender was hilarious. Definitely worth checking out.

I love this place. We come here every year for our anniversary or for a birthday. They are remodeling right now and will be open in February. This is much better than any other teppanyaki restaurant in all of Scottsdale. It is worth the wait.

Iv been coming here since the late 80's, Masa the owner is a frend ,the service is great the atmosphere is great  , the food is execelent . thia place was the only Japaneese resturant in Scottsdale . it's the grandaddy of them all . There was a time I used to go there 3 times a week . This place is an institution in Phoenix  .Try it you will be pleased.
I'm a regular here. I always enjoy the crab rolls and of course the filet..... Mmmmm melt in your mouth pieces. Consistenly good ****

Outstanding service from Nuko...The rolls and sushi are of great quality considering the price. You must try the point break and the candy cane rolls -They are to die for. You can eat well for two by sharing sushi and rolls for approximately $ 42 + tip. Love this place and think it will become my go to sushi place - They also have the teppanyaki tables which I haven't tried yet.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! I've been eating at Kyoto for years. The service is good, the food is amazing, and the atmosphere is chill. 
My friends and I go here and love sitting around the table for teppanyaki because the showmen are really funny and entertaining. 
I will keep going here and I will always name Kyoto first in my recommendations for great sushi places.

I am actually shocked I have never written a review since I have been coming here for 15+ years. I wish I could give more than 5 stars! 
 
There is nothing I don't love here.  From the amazing lunch bento boxes that are very decently priced to the sushi and teppenyaki tables.  Sitting at the sushi bar is the way to go!  All the guys back there are awesome and fun to watch.  Brandon is the best! 
Group nights you have to do the teppenyaki tables! Entertaining and good food.  I have had many birthday celebrations growing up at those teppenyaki tables. 
I am such a creature of habit here but I can't help it - I love it!!  My go to's: Tako Salad (the spicy ponzu is heaven in a liquid - I want the recipe!), house salad (also obsessed with this dressing - best in town) & Crazy Roll (Shrimp Tempura and Spicy Tuna - you cant go wrong) get it with a side of the spicy ponzu and its a party in your mouth! My dad always gets the salmon kama and its so delicate and perfectly cooked.  Something new to the menu that I now love is the crispy rice with spicy tuna.  I could go on and on.  Just come try for yourself.

Went for sushi and cocktails on a Friday night. I don't have much to say about the cocktails. I had a gin martini. The sushi was superior. The fish was extremely fresh. Rice was cooked perfectly. The yellowtail had been flown in that morning and it melted in my mouth. The eel sauce balanced the saltiness of the soy. (Note: They even have gluten free tamari.) The ponzu sauce in the seaweed salad was rich with flavor. Not oily. Texture was spot on. Ambiance was a retro 80's Japanese vibe. Don't turn up this little gem. Considering the location, the prices were comparable with other sushi places in the area. Will go back again for sure.
So glad this place reopened.  Great service, amazing food, and fantastic ambiance.  Can't wait to come back with a big group of friends for teppanyaki.

My go to place for sushi.  5 because the price is right.  Point Break roll will rock your world.  Bartender is a really nice guy.  Ambience is old school and is a nice break from a lot of the sushi spots in old town.
Service is amazing! Food? Delicious! Nice place. Will definitely come back to have my birthday here! Sooooo good!

We went pretty late at night with a big group, and the service was amazing! I think our main waitress was named Maria and she was super thoughtful, polite, and joked around with our rambunctious group. The manager (I assume) also helped our table out with drinks, utensils, etc. 

We were seated quickly and checked on regularly. The chef who cooked our teppanyaki was awesome too. The food and drinks were super good (I loved the miso soup), but the service really stood out to me. It can be hard to make sure everyone at a big table always has what they need, and the staff here really went above and beyond.

I would definitely come again!

Kyoto is back after a long renovation and its as great as ever. Many of the same chefs and staff and all of the same menu items and recipes. The Volcano Roll and Vegas Roll are 2 of our favorites . It's high quality sushi at a reasonable price. And the same local ownership service experience abounds.

First the valet tried to force us to valet by telling us he needed to back our car in. I asked him why? Am i required to park backwards? He said no, i need to back it in so i can pull it out easier. I said is valet parking required in this lot? He said no, to which i responded i didnt valet so youre not pulling my car out. I understand it was slow and he wasn't getting any tips but i didn't appreciate someone trying trick me into something. When we got there we had about an hour n a half to eat n get to our movie. The service was slow, it took forever to get any food and they only brought out one item at a time. We sat there for a long time with empty plates before the next came out. We ordered 5 things so it took a very very long time and they had 4 or 5 sushi chefs and it was not busy. By the third i had to ask them to see what was going on because we had a movie to catch. The food was pretty good though. Aside from that our waitress only checked on us once at the end of the night and the plates were pretty visibly worn. Which i know I'm anal but it bothers me. Get some decent plates they shouldn't be full of chips and wear. The manager comped me for taking so long with our food but i dont care about $10 I care about good service. Overall not a good experience. Pretty disappointed because i used to go there a lot years ago and i told my gf how good it was and they made me a liar lol. I wouldn't go back. Good sushi places are a dime a dozen now and if im eating raw fish id like to see that they take their job seriously.

Been coming here for over 20 years and prices have hardly changed.  Great fresh sushi at the lowest prices around. 5 big pieces of fresh Tuna for $5 and all hot lunches under $5 as well. Has a very interesting night life on Friday and Saturday and $6 larger Japanese beer and sake.

One star for the most terrible service in recent memory.  Our server "DK" was outright rude and horrible, and outright ignored us when she wasn't making us uncomfortable.   As a former waitress of 14 years, I have the utmost respect, patience and tolerance for my former bretheren - but this woman needs to go.  BAD DK!  Otherwise, our Teppiniyaki (sp?) chef was wonderful, the food was delicious and fresh and a solid four stars.  I have been going to Kyoto since 1995 and it remains a fun and festive place with very reasonable prices.  Too bad it was ruined this time by DK!   DK needs a different job, more suited to her personallity, like euthanizing kittens or something.

They don't cook the fried rice in front of you.  The scallops are the sandiest I have ever tasted...almost not edible. The vegetables tasted like...vegetables...minus flavor. The soup was salty. The salad was...ok. There is nothing desireable about the teppanyaki experience. The sushi looked good. I won't ever know if it is because I have no desire to go back there. Since there are other restaurants that have amazing sushi...I won't be back. Last, the server, was sub par and didn't deserve the tip we gave her. Don't go here...there are so many restaurants that are better in Scottsdale.

Economical but only so-so sushi...

I had tried Kyoto years ago and found it pretty disappointing in terms of sushi quality, but since it has remained open, I decided to give it another try in case I had simply had a poor initial experience.

I have now tried it twice in two weeks, and it still is a generally disappointing experience. While the lunch menu prices are great, the sashimi quality remains off. The first week it just tasted bland, and the second week is was bland, overly wet and spongy in texture to the point that I was slightly nervous about eating it.

Both times I had the Sashimi lunch special which is nicely priced. Each time, my miso soup was barely warm, and not very flavorful.

The first week I also had a spicy tuna hand roll, which was substantial in size, but totally lacking flavor and spice. The tuna preparation was generally incorrect.

Service was just ok, and both times my server failed to check back with me after delivering my food to be sure it was ok. 

Perhaps the cooked dishes are a better choice.

My first Sushi experience ever when I lived in Phoenix. Still in my mind as the best place I've ever been. Pretty famous place for famous people. I remember the owner being a really friendly guy and there are actually Japanese sushi masters making the sushi.

It's an authentic and traditional Japanese restaurant in the heart of Scottsdale. Wow, talk about an oxymoron. But, hey, I give props to a sushi place that offers more than loud music, vibrant colors and cream cheese rolls. This place is great for a quiet dinner (at least it was quiet when I went) and for enjoying big slices of sashima. 

Granted, I've been once, but the lasting impression I got was that it's a rare find in Phoenix. Downside is you have to cross into Scottsdale to go, so that's what keeps me away.
The service was very quick and the waiters were very friendly. The food was great as well. I wish they had a more detailed sushi menu for people who are new to sushi.

I have come home again. Soft open tonight and back to form. I highly recommend the Jaw Dropper roll, the Spirited Away cocktail, & leave at the weeaboo attitude at the door! Don't come in speaking your anime inspired San and Chan, do bring an empty stomach and the desire to have a great time. Drink and be merry for tomorrow is soon upon!

I am originally from California and I have eaten at all sorts of sushi places.  For me, when I come to eat sushi, I am concerned about the sushi.  I have read some of the reviews below and don't know why people are concerned about the ambiance as much, or the selection of sake/wine, etc.  

I would say if I were to come here again, I would not order rolls.  Their rolls were so thick I probably needed extra large chopsticks.  Their seaweed salad and sashimis on the other hand were absolutely delicious.  The price was very reasonable for the amount of food that we got.  I would come here again because this is one of the few quality tasting sushi places I have found so far in Arizona.

Eh? Not impressed, I came Years ago and comparing quality I can see standards are fleeting. 

I ordered 3 sushi rolls and I can say im not impressed, all came out promptly however the third was an eel  variety that actually had bones in it. After my first bite and attempt to save my esophagus I was turned off and couldn't finish anything..

For being 8-9 on a Friday I was disappointed there we're more empty tables than not..

Saving grace saki comes with every beer? Yes please!! This may have been my last horrah (sp?)  For Scottsdale dining for some time..

This is one of my go-to lunch places since it is one of the few restaurants in the area besides Quiznos , Chipotle or the food court at the mall where you can get a lunch for under $10.  Actually, it is under $5.  Serious value!  I love the bento boxes, everything is always fresh.  I usually get the teriaki chicken since I don't like fried so much or sometimes when I feel like a splurge I get the sashimi.  Either way it is always good.

Point break roll - awesome!  Soft-shell crab - best I've ever had!  I love Kyoto!

With choices to sit, eat, and drink at 1) the bar, 2) tables, 3) teppan table, and 4) sushi bar - you can live it up in many delicious ways!

Located near other good sushi places, this one you may not see from the street.  So I think this place is more known by the locals, and oh so good.

Very nice service, and less pretentious than the others just up the street.  I recommend this for a couple on a date, or a small group.  The teppan table seats 6 or 8, which is also fun for a little party, anniversary, birthday, etc.

Sushi: 2/5
I ordered softshell crab maki roll and another maki roll that I can't quit recall the name of it.  Kyoto's softshell crab roll was salty and excessively over-battered.  At first, I blamed myself for soaking my sushi in too much soy sauce but bites after bites; I still tasted salt even when there was no added soy sauce.  Last piece, I separately tried the softshell crab by itself and all I tasted was salt.  The other roll was consisted of several different types of fish folded with a central piece of avocado.  The roll was served deep-fried in a pool of sauce.  A tint of sourness of their sauce was a surprising taste and quite unique.  However, I was not impressed.  The creativity was appreciated but the execution needed some more work.

In addition, I found their menu(s) very confusing.  Kyoto's main menu only lists tappenyaki items.  They also have a separate laminated sushi menu that was given to us to share among eight people?, which only contains a few maki items.  I was very confused when I was also given another different sushi order menu that lists additional nigiri and maki rolls in their own acronyms.  How many hoops do I have to jump through in order to get my sushi ordered?  The acronyms without any descriptions were worthless to be given to the customers.  They were nothing more than scribbles on a piece of paper.

Tappenyaki: 3/5
I can't judge on how good the food tastes but I sure enjoyed their impressive performance.  The flaming volcanic onion, the fire surrounded the teppan, the style and technique of cutting with their aciculate knife in a blink of an eye.  Unfortunately, the show was the highlight of our dining experience at Kyoto restaurant and hopefully the food tasted as good as the performance.

Service: No Star?
Dian, our server, despicably greeted us with her agitated facial expression as we asked for our separate checks soon after we were seated.  She scowled as she informed us that there will be a 20% gratuity on our bills because the large number of party.  Everybody gladly agreed and acknowledged.  What remains bothersome was the fact that she was paid 20% of our combined bills to do her job, the job she was already paid to do.  With her attitude and incompetence, she sure did not deserve her tip.  Servers are supposed to be motivated to provide great service with the tip they are receiving at the end of their customers' meals.  I usually don't mind paying for x% gratuity when I am with a big party but this is a perfect example of how one takes advantage of the system.   

The night didn't just end with just her grumpiness.  Just out of a friend's curiosity, he asked Dian politely if the restaurant carried Inarizushi.  Dian ignorantly replied, "I do not speak Japanese." I just didn't believe that came out of our server's mouth to a customer that was paying for her atrocious service.  Not only she was ignorant as a waitress at a Japanese restaurant, she could easily come across rude and offensive.   And yes, the rudeness and grouchiness went on the whole night, from the beginning to end.

Parking and etc: 2/5
Kyoto is located in Old Town, Scottsdale, which is probably the only good thing this place has to offer.  It is close to those who are looking forward to the night life in downtown Scottsdale.  They also have their own private parking lot, which is definitely a plus.

However, Kyoto didn't appear to be that busy as we arrived and we still waited for at least half an hour, perhaps more.  By the time we were seated, there were many guys and girls in their mini black dresses sitting on the benches and overflowing the bar area.

Leaving Kyoto with an extreme disappointment, I was surprised how Kyoto is surviving the recession with such poor food and their horrific service.   This restaurant is by far the worst I have tried in Scottsdale.   So, do not waste your time and money because there are many other strong candidates out there in the area.  Overall, Kyto deserves 2/5 with no star in service in my opinion.

Kyoto is what I like to call the "diner of sushi places."  This isn't necessarily a negative.  The prices are very fair, and the atmosphere is very laid back.  

In an area of super "hip" sushi, it's nice to have a place with a local feel.  If you are looking for fancy, out of the box rolls, exceptional service, or a great ambiance, this isn't the place for you.

If you're looking for cheap, good, normal sushi at a great price it's worth a shot.
